boardgame.name: Baalbuddy
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome, you degenerate.
...
Your travels will have brought you to these two worlds. Earth, and an unnamed fantasy world. A portal between the two has opened, allowing the special blend of clichés, lewdness, and general stupidity of each to mix and become something truly great.

boardgame.name: Sekirei Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Shin Tokyo, a bustling urban metropolis and chosen location of the soon-to-begin Sekirei Game. Unlike chess or card games this is a considerably more dangerous activity, a battle royale between 108 beings known as Sekirei and their chosen human partners, all aiming to be the last pair standing.

The reward for all your hard work will be to fly in the sky with your flock of wagtails.

boardgame.name: Barking Spiders: The Game
boardgame.description:
Finally, a game that combines the best parts of Phase 10 (forming movements; dropping kids off at the pool) with UNO (skipping opponents; making “number one” jokes) while eliminating all the lame parts (keeping score, needing to learn Spanish, foregoing scatological humor).

Here's how it works: Use Clumps, Streaks and Flushes to form your best movements out of Mass or Gas cards. Once your movement is complete, be the first player to drop your kids off at the pool to finish the hand. Now get to work on your next movement. You have to pass five movements but you can do them in any order. See? Easy.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
Barking Spiders is an elegant and classy way to play cards using gastronomic euphemisms. Game play is similar to Gin Rummy or Phase 10, except you're using Gas and Mass Cards to form Movements. Form all5 movements and DropYour Kids Off at The Pool (discard all your cards) and you win!
You can see our instructional video at barkingspidersgame.com if you don't feel like reading the manual. You can also email any questions and recipes to barkingspidersgame@gmail.com.

boardgame.name: Broadsword (Issue 13 - Apr 2021)
boardgame.description:
Broadsword
Issue 13

April 2021

boardgame.name: Kindled Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

School's in session! The newest students at the venerable Magaambya school of magic must begin their academic careers with tests of their skill and resourcefulness. The heroes can learn much from their teachers and fellow students, but must beware of mysterious secrets and sinister plots. The rigors facing any Magaambya students are steep, but the heroes must also contend with strange infestations and supernatural intruders in the school's ancient halls. Education is far from easy at the oldest and most prestigious magic academy in the world!

boardgame.name: Broadsword (Issue 12 - Mar 2021)
boardgame.description:
Trash Gremlins (level 1)
Dretches in the Garden (level 1)
Snakes in a Bar (level 3)
Lair of the Snake Queen (level 4/10/16)
Blood Baptism (level 1)
Sea Hag’s Lair (level 2)
Mausoleum of the Mirage Mage (level 3)
Tower of Gnolls (level 3)
Lost Dungeon of the Demon Cultists (level 3)
Into the Blood Mine (level 3)
Children of Demons (level 3)
Innocent Blood (level 5)
Descent Into Hell (level 5)
Wrath of the Demon Lord (level 7)
Kobold Alone (levels 1-4)

boardgame.name: Strength of Thousands Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the Introduction:

The Magaambya is perhaps the greatest and oldest academy of magic in the world, and its students know they are supported by the strength of thousands of students who’ve come before them. History, magical lore, and much more can be found within the walls of the school, but students of the Magaambya aren’t confined to the campus. They are expected to learn from, and share knowledge with, the wider world—and that wider world has plenty of adventure to offer!

boardgame.name: Fists of the Ruby Phoenix Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the Introduction:

The powerful sorcerer Hao Jin has returned to the Material Plane to preside as grand judge over her world-famous fighting competition, the Ruby Phoenix Tournament. Contenders from around Golarion flock to the tournament to compete for a prize from Hao Jin’s legendary treasure vault. Does your team have what it takes to become this year’s Ruby Phoenix Champions?

boardgame.name: Broadsword (Issue 14 - May 2021)
boardgame.description:
Broadsword
Issue 14

May 2021

boardgame.name: Broadsword (Issue 15 - Jun 2021)
boardgame.description:
Broadsword
Issue 15

May 2021

boardgame.name: Shadowcaster
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Before time, before light, before life… there was darkness. Even now, that darkness waits beyond the edge of all things, in the void beyond worlds and mortals and gods. Eventually, even the brightest of lights and the greatest of stars must dim and gutter, the longest day must yield to twilight. Darkness underlies all reality, and shadow is the only eternity.

boardgame.name: Master Class: Eldmage (5e)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The halfling war-mage, body bent with age but with an undeniable clarity in her gaze, holds up the gnarled fingers on her left hand with a swift, practiced gesture that belies her age. Speaking words of power in a deep, booming voice—words that reverberate with layered eldritch meaning—the halfling unleashes a cone of snow and ice that scours the terrain in front of her, while a gleaming wall of ice shelters her allies from the storm.

boardgame.name: Harry Potter: Catch the Golden Snitch
boardgame.description:
Bring all the speed and excitement of a real Quidditch match to your home with Catch the Golden Snitch, a Quidditch game for witches, wizards, and muggles. Everyone plays at the same time as cards are quickly passed from player to player, each trying to build sets and earn points. In the center of the action lies an open Quidditch Chest, with a Quaffle, two Bludgers, and the all-important Golden Snitch. When you lay down certain cards, these magical items come out to play! A pair of Chaser cards lets you steal another player’s set, but if you’ve earned the Quaffle, you’re safe. Play a pair of Bludger cards, grab a Bludger, and throw it at a player of your choice -- if they swat the Bludger in air and it hits another player, that player must discard the cards in their hand. The action moves faster than a Nimbus 2000 as cards change hands, sets hit the table, and Bludgers hit their mark. When the Golden Snitch launches from the chest and into the air, grab it – it’s worth extra points! The game ends when the Golden Snitch is in hand; the player with the most points wins. For fast-paced action and excitement, play Catch the Golden Snitch with your wizarding family and friends.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
New in shrink wrap.
All prices are inclusive of VAT, but do not include shipping costs, and a possible fee, if you pay using Paypal.
Shipping Cost: please look below

boardgame.name: Now I Lay Me Down to Sleep (5e)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

No one can be sure if household spells are the origin of more powerful magic or intentional mimicry of the tools of legendary heroes. Some point to the similarities between the verbal components and prayers whispered by parents as they tuck in their children. Others suspect the same capricious fey the wards were meant to repel were responsible for spreading and developing the powerful magic. But as adventurers travel miles from home, they find the same terrors that went bump in the night threatening the very balance of the cosmos. And the prayers and stuffed animals that protected them when they were dewy-eyed children are the same weapons that will save the world from the encroaching darkness.

boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

boardgame.name: Warbands: Simple Stat Blocks for Fighting Squads (SF)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Many great stories, in history as well as literature, feature small bands of heroes holding out against large numbers of foes. This might be holding an important objective against mobs of enemies or taking out groups of guards defending a villain’s lair. No matter the adventure or the situation, it’s useful to have mobs of foes ready to throw at the characters!

boardgame.name: Warbands: Simple Stat Blocks for Fighting Squads (PF2)
boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Darnitt's Straw Tower (5e)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There’s a story—a story so old it’s hard to even know whether it’s true or a fable—about three brothers who each built very different houses to keep enemies out. It boils down to a moral lesson about building with bricks, I suppose, but I’ve long had a soft spot for the brother who made his house from straw. It may not have looked like much, and that brother may have come to an exceptionally untimely end, but there’s a pure and humble belief in thinking you can build a house from straw and find your refuge there.

boardgame.name: Darnitt's Straw Tower (SF)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There’s a story—a story so old it’s hard to even know whether it’s true or a fable—about three brothers who each built very different houses to keep enemies out. boardgame.name: The Village of Cambry
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ready to run.. Village: The village of Cambry (5e) - is a ready to play and fully realised village location that can be dropped straight into your 5e game with little to no prep.

This fantastic location will offer up numerous story hooks, NPCs, quests and possibilities both for the player and game master alike.

The small, rural village of Cambry has been relatively quiet and prosperous recently, though this was not always the case. Raids from lizardfolk, unlikely allies, moonshine, mysteries, quests, jobs, favours and drunken bears will keep your party entertained and will spark the imagination for both you and your players!

boardgame.name: The Dirk in the Dark
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ready to Run Tavern: The Dirk in the Dark - is a ready to play and fully realised, system agnostic, tavern that can be dropped straight into your game with no prep.

Calling the Dirk in the Dark a rough tavern would be the biggest and possibly the last mistake you make if in ear-shot of its notorious patrons. Filled with thugs, drunks and miscreants that are nearly as tough as the slops that they serve up to drink.

This PDF contains information on the tavern itself, the landlord, serving girl and includes three standout patrons with their own stories and hooks to throw into your game. to round things off is a d8 list of rumours, each with a potential story seed and finally a blank map of the Dirk in the Dark tavern, for when things get rough.

boardgame.name: The Triblade Smithy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ready to run.. Blacksmith: The Triblade Smithy (5e) - is a ready to play and fully realised, location that can be dropped straight into your 5e game with no prep.

Complete with all its staff, special items and maps for online or tabletop play. This fantastic location will offer up numerous story hooks, npc interactions, quests and possibilities both for the player and GM alike.

The Triblade Smithy is run by three talented siblings and their young apprentices, producing beautifully forged and skillfully engraved weapons, armour, tools and more.

boardgame.name: The Arcane Vagrant
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ready to run.. Shop: The Arcane Vagrant (5e) - is a ready to play and fully realised, arcane shop that can be dropped straight into your 5e game with no prep.

Run by Artemis Craggleskip a retired gnome adventurer and wizard, The Arcane Vagrant is a popular shopping spot for the magically inclined and adventurer alike.

This PDF contains information on the shop itself, the owner, manager and barbarian security guard. Each have their own stories and hooks to throw into your game as required. In addition, there is a notice board with several job opportunities for gold-strapped parties and hooks for GMs. Finally, there is also is a map included of The Argane Vagrant, for when things get serious or a spell goes awry. A seperate map file for VTT use is included (72px per square).

boardgame.name: The Family
boardgame.description:
The Family is a 2-4 player tabletop card game, putting YOU in the shoes of a crime boss.

Pit yourself against your friends and family and see who comes on top as the best crime boss. You’ll need to draw from the deck, place associates on locations and eliminate your rivals to gain control of your turf and win.

Turn types:
Draw cards for nifty ways to make your position better or maybe worse (a gamble worth taking most of the time).
Attack rivals using dice when you’ve gained the right strategic advantages.
Command locations to receive strategic bonuses.
Reinforce locations you occupy to ensure success.

Be ruthless, or you will not succeed.

This game requires both strategy, and a little bit of luck too.

It’s turn based, you each get a turn in order, however some strategic bonuses you earn will allow you a second turn, such as attacking after you’ve drawn cards.

boardgame.name: Light Castle
boardgame.description:
Three warriors must save 4 keepers of the castle of light who have turned into evil monsters, and they must try to maintain as many towers to get high scores in their mission.

The gameplay is simple, during 7 rounds any player rolls 5 dice, 2 of them will activate the effects of the managers that can be to destroy towers, bring fog to the towers, among others, then with the 3 remaining dice you can organize their values ​​in one or more rows of actions of the warriors, and thus obtain bonuses in diamonds also complete a row that will give you many points, but you must organize them as more consecutively as possible or if you cannot be blocked, these actions range from increasing your attack, increasing your movements through the castle towers, mushrooms to control luck, placing books on the towers and incredible powers among others.

At any time you can exchange diamonds with the ghost merchant for useful objects, if it is in solo mode the player must beat a certain score to win, or if there are several players, the player with the most points wins the game by: putting books together, delivering potions to those in charge, for towers that are not destroyed, but there must be a minimum of 2 fog figures, for completed rows among other scores.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: War for Chicken Island: Playmat
boardgame.description:
This Neoprene playmat was available as an add-on with the Kickstarter Campaign.

It allows the grid to be expanded outside of the island tiles for leaders or units that reach outside of the island.

boardgame.name: Temerity
boardgame.description:
2 player strategy game with the objective to deal the highest attack before the cards run out. Players use cards either face up or face down to achieve their goal.

Players play 1 or more cards from their hand and can optionally reveal a face down card placed on a previous turn.

When the cards in the deck runs out, the game ends and the player who performed the highest attack during the game is the winner.

boardgame.name: Penalty Challenge: Teams
boardgame.description:
This is a "Teams" version of the former "Penalty Challenge" game. In this version every player will be dealt a complete team of 11 players, with a similar set of shooting directions and star players.

Players will also be given specific goalkeeper gloves to manage during the game, so in this version the goalkeeper will have a more strategic role and in every shot the defending team will decide whether to wait to see the shot direction or to risk moving to one direction and be able to use a neutral glove and occupy more goal spaces.

The mechanism is the same as in "Penalty Challenge" the original game, the team shooting will put a shooting card pointing at the intended goal and after the defending team place their goalkeeper the shooter will be revealed. If the goalkeeper guesses the direction, they will put gloves to cover the circles inside the goal. Those circles has numbers and the shooter needs to choose one empty circle and roll the die to match with one of the number of that circle. If that happens it will be a goal, otherwise the shot will be blocked.

First team obtaining 5 goals will be the winner of the game!

boardgame.name: Rune (Vol. 2, No. 0 - Mar 2019)
boardgame.description:
Rune
Volume 2, Numero 0
Marzo 2019

boardgame.name: Dog Lover
boardgame.description:
In Dog Lover, you fetch cards, collect bones, and gather food for your lovable dogs. You rescue them from the shelter, train them on new tricks, and cherish their unique traits. The player who takes care of their beloved dogs best will score the most victory points and win!

In more detail, you start the game with a random dog card — which come in small, medium, and big sizes — as well as a random "special trick" card. Shuffle the game cards, then lay out the top nine cards in a 3x3 grid. Next to that, lay out three dog trick cards in an adjacent column and three rescued dogs in another column. The player farthest from the start player places the watch dog token next to one of the rows or columns, then the game is ready to play.

On a turn, choose one of your trick cards, rotating it as you desire, then collect cards from the 3x3 grid that match the pattern on the trick card, e.g., common polyomino shapes. You can take at most one card in the row or column under the protection of the watch dog. You can play and tuck cards both before and after you collect cards from the grid. What do you do with what you collect?


Dog cards sit in front of you immediately. Good boy!
Food cards are exchanged for one of the four types of food.
Adoption cards go in your hand, and you can exchange two for a rescued dog, which comes with a special power or endgame bonus.
Favorite Things cards are dog toys that are more valuable when you collect them in sets.
Training cards can be tucked under a dog for bonus points, or you can exchange several of them to gain a new trick, which gives you more card-grabbing options each turn.
Walk cards are worth bonus points when tucked under a dog.
Bone cards give you a bonus for fed dogs if you collect enough of them.
Trait cards give an ongoing power and an endgame bonus, but you must attach it to a dog the turn you claim it; otherwise, you must usually discard multiple cards.


When the "End Game" card appears in the deck, you complete the round so that each player has the same number of turns, then you tally points. Each dog has a food requirement. If you meet that requirement, the dog and all its traits and tucked cards will be worth points. However, if you don't give the dog the right type and amount of food, you score -2 points for that dog and ignore all tucked cards that would otherwise give you points (Don't let your dogs go hungry!). The player who scores the most points is the ultimate dog lover!

boardgame.name: Mahou Shoujo Kishu Apocalypse 4ever
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Till handling!

I System7 så beskriver man ett problem på så hög nivå som möjligt, ”det finns en låst dörr”, och frågar sedan efter attityden till hur man löser problemet. Det är sedan upp till spelaren att beskriva hur denne tacklar problemet.

Vi tar ett exempel: ett matteprov. I System7 så är matteprovet en kulmen på en längre ansträngning där attityden till problemet spelar större roll än matematikkunskaperna. Så istället för att slå för Matematik, så kan spelaren bestämma att man försöker tackla problemet med en nattsession med mycket kaffe och viljestyrka.

Det finns två sorters handlingar: enkla handlingar och motsatta handlingar. Enkla handlingar är sådana där man försöker göra något, men ingen försöker hindra det. Exempel kan vara att klara det nationella provet i matte, laga mat eller hinna i tid till skolan. Motsatta handlingar är sådana som någon försöker hindra en att utföra. Exempel skulle kunna vara att springa fortast, bli utsedd till som klassens toppelev, eller sopa till någon.

boardgame.name: All Is Bomb
boardgame.description:
The princess is sleeping. You, the royal servant, must prepare the perfect breakfast for her before she wakes up, which is difficult, because everything is a bomb. You must consult the prophets about what kind of breakfast she wants (before they explode) – you must prepare the desired dish (before it explodes) – and serve it to the princess the moment she opens her eyes (and explodes...everything explodes, this is inevitable).

All is Bomb is a quick and puzzly solo/cooperative 18-card game for one or two players. Your goal is to manipulate the deck, so the princess ultimately eats the desired dish – but before you discard too many or too important cards.

Aside from the initial setup, there are no random or hidden elements to the game. Each turn, you play one of your "equipped cards". The played card's number says which card from the deck you "equip" next; you then perform the played card's action and recycle the card back into the deck. When the cards are played, they progress from the passive state to ignited state and are ultimately discarded, so the whole deck is constantly on the brink of exploding.

You win by fulfilling 3 win conditions: you must play Prophet cards to find out what is the "desired dish" - you must prepare this dish by igniting it - and ultimately, you must play the Princess to "equip" the "desired dish"!

The game also comes with 6 modular expansions, a variant and a campaign.

boardgame.name: Mugrugni
boardgame.description:
A game of battles and conquests in which only Mugrugni can be heard.

In this board game perfect for an evening with friends, you will lead one of the five tribes of wild boars to conquer the 40 districts of Genoa. You can choose the Sciacaeli, the Scignuri, the Beline, the Besughi and the Legere to defeat your enemies with cards, dice, strategy and ... fangs! Immerse yourself in a game of conquests and battles where only your skill as a strategist will determine the winner.

During his turn, the player moves his boar armies to take possession of the districts under the control of the opponents.
Battles are resolved by rolling dice and using cards to help the attack succeed. The player who manages to conquer all the territories designated for him at the beginning of the game or the player who has scored the most points wins

(Publisher's description)

boardgame.name: Cabbage Farm
boardgame.description:
In Cabbage Farm, you collect and deliver cabbages to complete target cards. To do this, you use your worker to maximize the chance of collecting harvested cabbage. Players are allowed to steal coins and cabbages by using Lampy and Cukoo (that is, actions that allow you to move the chicken and sheep) to be placed in the same spot as another player.

Players play as cabbage farmers trying to collect the harvested cabbages on the farm according to the order(s) received from the Target Card. Completing each order will gain points. On each turn, players can play Action Card, place work on Move Card and Complete Target Card. Points are scored for each completed Target Card, a pair of cabbage accumulates 3 points while 1 cabbage equals 1 point (these points apply at the end of the game in must be present in your hand excluding the cabbages used for Target Card) and 1 coin accounts for 1 point. The player with the most points wins.

Cabbage Farm is an ward winning board game design competition in Thailand. It was published in 2021 by Aroi Games. Cabbage Farm is family board game where you can enjoy farming cabbages with children and adult.

boardgame.name: Taboo Junior / Outburst Jr
boardgame.description: Taboo Junior and Outburst Junior in one box.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

boardgame.name: Kayros: A Game of Thieves
boardgame.description:
The god Kayros has summoned all the best thieves from every age to confront each other in a great tournament that will establish, once and for all, who is the greatest thief in each universe. To win, Robin Hood, Arsène Lupin and the other thieves will have to travel through time and space to steal the world's most precious treasures.

"Kayros: A Game of Thieves" is a board game for 1-6 players (solo, 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all).

Each player starts the game with a character who has his own abilities and characteristics.
Each turn the players draw 2 cards from the Main Deck (consisting of Tool and Event cards) and gain 1 coin.
On their turn, players can play cards from their hand to enhance their character and get in the way of their opponents. Some cards can be played on your opponent's turn, while others can only be played on your turn.
Coins can be used to trade with other players or to buy Silver and Gold Tools, cards that will greatly enhance your character!
The main purpose of the game is to steal the Treasures placed in the center of the table, but it is not the only way to win the game, in fact other factors contribute to the victory, including above all the Event cards which contain objectives that if completed, provide Victory Points.
The game ends when a player completes two sets of Treasures (a set is made up of three treasures of the same type or all of different types) and then the Victory Points are counted!

boardgame.name: Assassins Night
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurp:

EXECUTE.

Authorization granted.

Maneuver AF2B9.

Go dark.

Eliminate.

Those words set a plan in motion, but what plan? Something’s about to go down in Barcelona. Someone is marked for death. But who’s the target, and who’s pulling trigger?

Assassins Night is a campaign for Shadowrun, Sixth World where players can dive in and get involved in intrigue, action, and a plot that will shake the world.

boardgame.name: Gol'Og's Throne: Heir of Shadow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Continuing our Feywild/Shadowfell adventures this month, we have another Campaign Villain complete with schemes, minions, and adventure hooks! The orc warlock Gol'Og, Heir of Shadow, is ready to be the BBEG of your Tier 1 campaign along with his vicious Shadowclaw clan! Included with the full breakdown of Gol'Og and the Shadowclaw clan is the 5th-level adventure Gol'Og's Throne, the penultimate adventure for your characters to face off against the villain!

The Heir of Shadow
Gol'Og, Heir of Shadow, is a Fifth Edition villain designed to serve as a campaign-level threat for 1st- to 5th-level characters. After Gol'Og, an orc shaman found his prayers for power answered by an entity from the Plane of Shadow, he must balance his own ambitions against those of the spirit that now lives in his head.

In this document, GMs will find information that details Gol'Og's backstory, his lieutenants, his goals, and the resources and means he has available to pursue those goals. This document also includes Gol'Og's Throne, an adventure optimized for 5th-level characters where adventurers can confront Gol'Og directly in his lair within the Plane of Shadow. GMs can use this document to craft a whole Tier 1 campaign arc centered around Gol'Og and his cult of loyal followers, or simply take bits and pieces to create a shorter side quest or single-session adventure. Gol'Og and his cult can be placed in any campaign world that features orcs and a Plane of Shadow or a similar alternative.

Gol'Og's Throne
Gol'Og's Throne is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for three to six characters of 5th to 6th level and is optimized for a party of four 5th-level characters. The orc warlock Gol'Og and his Shadowclaw clan followers threaten to overlap the Plane of Shadow with the Material Plane. It will be up to a brave group of adventurers to travel through the shadow gate and defeat Gol'Og and his forces within his Plane of Shadow fortress. Should the adventurers fail, Gol'Og threatens to bring death and darkness through the shadow gate and into the Material Plane. This adventure can be placed into any campaign that includes multiple planes or dimensions, preferably including a plane of shadow, death, darkness, or similar.

boardgame.name: La Campaña del Peón
boardgame.description:
La Campaña del Peón is a free print & play roll-and-write game by Yovosgalo, in a campaign with weekly episodic adventures.


OBJECTIVE
Collect the most points in the campaign.

SETUP
In the game sheet you must identify the location of the pawn (Red) of your campaign.

FLOW OF THE GAME
In each turn you must throw the dice, each face of the die is a reference to each of the Chess pieces. The pawn must always move forward, one movement each turn.


Pawns dream, the lowest class of chess society has dreams of glory, they deeply yearn to triumph in battle. And when they rest their head on the pillow, they first dream of not being condemned to the straight lift of the board, not being condemned not to step back.

They fully yearn to be a splendid lady who gloats over the entire board full of pirouettes, they dream of stepping on sectors far from their initial jump in long straight runs or endless diagonals that cross the checkerboard, they dream of drawing equine jumps from here to there, with that rare zigzag that only they come out, they dream of being the king, who is allowed to think, rethink and take short steps towards any of the 4 cardinal points.

Every night our pawn dreams that he devours the entire board visiting the most remote squares, and while he goes through them he gathers fragments of his dreams that sparkle the warrior soul of the bravest of the board's dreamers.

boardgame.name: Under Mirt's Folly
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Under Mirt’s Folly is the new 200+ location mega-dungeon from Dunromin University Press

Mirt the Long Flame was a mighty wizard of years gone by. He fell in love, so the story goes, with a beautiful Goddess.

Using all his powers he built his true-love a temple and a pleasure palace with the intention of making her his wife. On midsummer’s eve he bent all his powers to calling her down to him, luring her to our world with the sweetest compliments and tempting gifts. After several hours of calling, she appeared and he proposed to her, explaining the wonderful life together he had planned for them.

She was not amused.

The blasted remains of the temple and the derelict palace, all made from the finest white marble, are all that remains of Mirt’s crazy ambitions. The abandoned ruins are now known by all now as Mirt’s Folly.

Of course, the anger of a mighty Goddess leaves deep scars in the landscape. A hundred years later the hill, despite being in civilised lands, remains an abandoned place of strange magic. It is the haunt of ghosts and monsters and all who go there return changed, fearful and anxious, if they return at all. No one knows the nature of the Curse of Mirt’s Folly and few desire to find out.

But Mirt was a great mage!? His powerful magic items and his many books of spells and research have never been found, not to mention the vast wealth he had accumulated. All this amazing loot must still be up there, in the ruins of the palace, or perhaps below it, in the catacombs he is said to have dug there.

But who is brave enough, or foolish enough, to go and look?

Under Mirt’s Folly is the latest production from Dunromin University Press. As with all our supplements, Under Mirt’s Folly represents astonishing value, offering excellent quality and quantity at rock-bottom prices:

A challenging scenario for a party of 4-8 characters of levels 5-8;
Written for OSRIC, OSR, 1st and 2nd Edition D&D and compatible with pretty much ANY FRPG you fancy;
More than 100 pages with over 250 encounter locations over 8 levels;

Four wandering monster tables;
A rumour table to inform and confuse;
New and inventive uses of all kinds of Monsters;
Powerful new magic items;
Tricks, traps and treasure enough to make any player salivate.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: 2 von 4: Hol sie Dir!
boardgame.description:
The somewhat different dice game, 4 dice, game instructions and XL game block with 150 sheets in a slipcase.

A fast and exciting dice game for the whole family. The basic principle is simple: Whoever fills out his game sheet completely and collects the most points wins!

In each round, only one player rolls the dice, but the other players are also allowed to take 2 out of 4 of the numbers rolled. But only the player who rolls the dice is allowed to fill in the number on the red dice.

Caution: "2 out of 4" is addictive! Therefore, in addition to the dice and the game instructions, a huge XL game block with 150 sheets is included! And now get to the dice when it's time: 2 out of 4 - Get it!

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 7 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8+
2 von 4 - Hol sie Dir! - Das etwas andere Würfelspiel Ein schnelles und spannendes Würfelspiel für die ganze Familie. Das Grundprinzip ist einfach: Wer sein Spielblatt vollständig ausfüllt und dabei die meisten Punkte sammelt, gewinnt! In jeder Runde würfelt nur ein Spieler, doch auch die anderen Mitspieler dürfen sich 2 von 4 der gewürfelten Zahlen eintragen. Doch nur wer würfelt darf auch die Zahl auf dem roten Würfel eintragen... Vorsicht: "2 von 4" macht süchtig! Deswegen ist neben den Würfeln und der Spielanleitung auch ein riesiger XL-Spieleblock mit 150 Blättern dabei! Und jetzt ran an die Würfel wenn es heißt: 2 von 4 - Hol sie Dir!
Inhalt: 4 Würfel Spielanleitung XL-Spielblock mit 150 Blatt im Stülpkarton
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 7 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8+
2 von 4 - Hol sie Dir! 2x Ersaztblock - Das etwas andere Würfelspiel 2 x - XL-Ersatzblock für "2 von 4" - 150 Blatt neuer Spielspaß. Für große Spielrunden, endlose Würfelabende und alle, die gar nicht genug kriegen können.
Inhalt: 2x XL-Spielblock mit 150 Blatt
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Temple of 1000 Swords
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

An ancient temple to the forgotten god of swords lies hidden behind a waterfall. Great piles of swords choke its halls and spill out into nearby streams and waterways. What strangeness still treads and what swords will you draw in the Temple of 1000 Swords?


A tarot-inspired fantasy RPG dungeon delve for 3rd level characters
Created for Old-School Essentials (B/X), compatible with RPGs with old-school sensibilities
A 19 room, keyed dungeon, easily insertable into a fantasy RPG campaign, sandbox, or “west marches” style table
d100 weird, magic, and cursed swords to discover. Roll to search the piles!
Anything is a sword--create weird sword creations through the temple's cursed magic
New monsters, factions, spirits, and curses
Includes a high-resolution unlabeled map for VTT use

boardgame.name: ¡Con Café!
boardgame.description:
¡Bienvenidos a la Panadería! Welcome to the Mexican Bakery!
The fresh pan dulce in that display case looks delicious! Who will take home the best combination of pastries from the panadería?

Take turns filling up trays with combinations of sweet bread, one or two cards at a time. When a tray looks too delicious to pass up, take it! You must decide whether to take a tray or push your luck by holding off and adding more cards to the trays on the table. Take the tray that will give you the best scoring combinations to earn the most points.
But not so fast: The last player to take a tray earns a cup of coffee - and a bonus action, ¡con café!
At the end of the game, add up the combined score of all your pan dulce to determine the winner.
Every round you play goes better ¡con café!

The object of the game is to collect sets of cards that will score the most points.
Divide the deck into four stacks of pan dulce cards, face up, forming the display case. Each round begins by placing one tray per player in the center of the table.
On your turn, you may select one or two cards from the display case and place them onto one or two trays that are not yet full. Or, instead of adding more cards, you may take one of the trays and all of the cards it contains. You place those cards in front of you, and then pass for the remainder of the round. When only one tray remains on your turn, you must take it (no matter how full it is), but you also select a café card that grants a bonus action.
After three rounds, each player scores the combination of cards they have taken throughout the game, and the player with the highest score is the winner!

boardgame.name: System7
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

System7 är ett revolutionerande rollspelssystem från Rävsvans Förlag som är avsett att främja beskrivande och framförallt rollgestaltande. Realism är inte en viktig poäng i systemet, som i första hand är byggt för spel i mahou shoujou-genren (magiska flickor).

Syftet med systemet är inte att simulera verkligheten, utan att främja berättande och gestaltande utan att hänfalla åt friform eller åt spelledarens godtyckliga belönande av rollgestaltandet och beskrivandet. Tanken är att man faktiskt måste beskriva vad man gör och hur man gör det för att reglerna ska fungera. Målet är att attityden ska spela bra mycket större roll för handlingarna än i andra rollspel, samt att man inte ens får slå om man inte beskriver sin handling så att man vet vilket värde man använder för handlingen. Det vill säga, man kommer inte undan med ”jag skjuter”, för det räcker inte för att avgöra värdet.

boardgame.name: Teatime Adventures
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Teatime Adventures is a series of three one shot adventures, each able to fill between one and four teatime sessions. These cozy adventures are set in the fully realized LGBTQ+ and disability friendly town of Oakenbend. Filled with adventures featuring rich narrative gameplay mechanics that allow players to explore mysteries, relationships, and meaning.

Each adventure features a tea pairing and an honest to goodness homemade vegetarian recipe for the table to share!

boardgame.name: T10-System
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Vad du behöver

Du behöver en tiosidig tärning samt en rollperson inför det här kapitlet. Om du inte har en tiosidig tärning så kan det vara läge att skaffa en nu. Rollpersonen innehåller en del spelvärden som kommer att användas.

Handlingar

En ”handling” är ett försök att göra något. När man vill att ens rollperson ska utföra en handling i ett rollspel så beskriver man vad man försöker göra. Därefter kommer spelledaren att få ta hänsyn till huruvida utgången är säker eller inte, givet rollpersonens förmågor och den beskrivna handlingen.

En del handlingar är så vardagliga att man utgången är säker. Det är inte särskilt osannolikt att en normal person lyckas med att äta frukost eller få på sig kläderna. Det behöver man inte bry sig om.

Andra handlingar beror till stor del på hur skicklig man är. I dessa fall tittar man på rollpersonens spelvärden, och avgör om det räcker. Oftast är det spelledaren som gör bedömningen.

Åter andra handlingar är osäkra, eftersom det finns så många utomstående omständigheter. En person som är bra på något har större chans att lyckas än en som är dålig, men det är inte säkert att han lyckas. Det finns inget uppenbart resultat på dessa handlingar. Det är då som tärningsslag och regler kommer in i bilden.

User summary:

The system includes two RTF files:

5-page System
7-page "tactical" expansion

boardgame.name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Playmat
boardgame.description: This 777x536mm play mat is designed to work both with and without any combination of the expansions. It's made of thick 2mm neoprene, with stitching around the edges. It comes supplied inside a sturdy cardboard tube. Compatible with the Age of Artisans and Works of Wonder expansions.

Architects of the West Kingdom: Works of Wonder
