boardgame.name: Faller snö växer sten
boardgame.description:
Konventsscenario till Västmark Tredje Utgåvan till GothCon XXVII

From the introduction:

Välkommen till det första konventsäventyret till Västmark Tredje Utgåvan. Det är ett ganska stort äventyr i antalet sidor räknat, men trots det är det anpassat för att klaras av på ungefär fem timmar. Det är ett äventyr med öppen struktur, och det finns egentligen ingen klar tidslinje. Huvudsakligen bygger äventyret kring hur spelarna agerar och hur framförallt sju biroller agerar som respons. Det går alltså inte att säga att först händer A, sedan B och sedan C. Istället kan vi säga att birollerna kommer förmodligen att agera på det här sättet om spelarna gör A, och på ett annat sätt om spelarna gör B. Detta ställer naturligtvis krav på spelledaren.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as two PDF files

28-page Scenario
11-page Handouts

boardgame.name: Fem och slottsmysteriet
boardgame.description:
Konventsscenarop till Västmark Tredje Utgåvan till GothCon XXIX

From the introduction:

Välkommen till det tredje konventsäventyret till Västmark Tredje Utgåvan. Återigen så är det ett ganska stort äventyr i antal sidor räknat, men det är anpassat för att spelas igenom på ca fem timmar.

Äventyret är en fristående fortsättning från de två tidigare äventyren, ”Faller snö, växer sten” och ”Tokarnas natt”. Det är inget krav att ha spelat de tidigare äventyren, utan det borde gå alldeles utmärkt att spela detta äventyr utan att ha spelat den tidigare delen.

Detta äventyr, ”Fem och slottsmysteriet”, tar vid ungefär tre månader efter att det förra äventyret slutade. Det är samma fi gurer som i det tidigare äventyret, men deras bakgrundsbeskrivning har utökats med händelserna från tidigare äventyr och deras personlighet har utvecklats en aning om man jämför med förra årets konventsäventyr. En femte fi gur har dessutom tillkommit.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as two PDF files

34-page Scenario
10-page Pre-generated characters
8-page play-aids (tracking sheets, hints, maps, etc.)


N.B. the pre-generated characters and play-aid materials appear also in the scenario file

boardgame.name: Tokarnas natt
boardgame.description:
Konventsscenario till Västmark Tredje Utgåvan till GothCon XXVIII

From the introduction:

Välkommen till det andra konventsäventyret till Västmark Tredje Utgåvan. Återigen så är det ett ganska stort äventyr i antal sidor räknat, men det är anpassat för att spelas igenom på ca fem timmar.

Äventyret är en fristående fortsättning från det förra äventyret, “Faller snö, växer sten”. Det är inget krav att ha spelat det förra äventyret, utan det borde gå alldeles utmärkt att spela detta äventyr utan att ha spelat den tidigare delen.

Detta äventyr, “Tokarnas natt”, tar vid ungefär en månad efter att det förra äventyret slutade. Det är samma fi gurer som i det tidigare äventyret, men deras bakgrundsbeskrivning har utökats med händelserna från det förra äventyret och deras personlighet har utvecklats en aning om man jämför med förra årets konventsäventyr. Det borde inte vara några problem för nya spelare att komma in i fi gurerna.

boardgame.name: Geografica Vistfarthi
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Geografica Vistfarthi innehåller allting som en rollspelare någonsin skulle vilja veta om riket Västmark, plus en hel del som de flesta inte ens visste att de behövde veta.

boardgame.name: Professor Rubik's Brain Fitness
boardgame.description:
Let Professor Rubik's Brain Fitness help you color your brain!

-From the back of the game

boardgame.name: 1971 Project Helios
boardgame.description:
The world froze relentlessly. There was no sunglight anymore. no feed. no heat. Fear the cold.

- From the back of the game case

boardgame.name: Pip's Spicy 5e Encounters
boardgame.description:
"Tired of random encounter tables leaving you disappointed in their genericness? Have some veterans in your party, not challenged by prewritten hordes of mooks? Just want to feel like your monsters were actually worth the XP they gave?

Well this book is for you! These single encounters can be introduced as random encounters, side quests, boss fights, or even to fill rooms in your dungeon. Just pick a recipe, and get to cookin!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: The Banner Saga Trilogy
boardgame.description:
Guide your caravan across the landscape of a breaking worlds, where the sun has stopped in the sky and the gods are dead. Bold leadership decisions, wise use of resources, and skillful battle tactics are vital to ensure that you and your clans make it thorough alive.

-From the back of the game case

boardgame.name: Giga Wrecker Alt
boardgame.description:
In the near future, where earth has been ravaged by robot invaders, the fate of the planet rests on the shoulders of a young girl who becomes more than human. Saved from death and cursed with cybernetic powers beyond comprehension, its up to Reika Rekkeiji to save humanity from the evil Ajeet!

-From the back of the game case

boardgame.name: Svalbard
boardgame.description:
Lovecraftian Horror in the Frozen North

A Roguelike Tabletop Scenario

From the introduction:

Svalbard is a standalone scenario that borrows elements from the world of H.P. Lovecraft. Through investigation, awareness, recollection, and comprehension, the players and their characters will experience a time-bending and relentless scenario as they are lost in time and space for an eventful evening!

The scenario is set on the Norwegian archipelago of Svalbard close to the North Pole in the year 1993. The characters are resourceful investigators sent to explore the mysteries surrounding a secret Russian mine deep below the frozen landscape. As time is running out, the characters need to stop an experiment gone horrible wrong—a warp in the time-space continuum that threatens to unleash the mad will of the daemon-sultan Azathoth.

The main mechanism of Svalbard is to explore, then die, then repeat. If you have read the book All you need is kill, seen the movie Edge of Tomorrow, played the board game Time Stories, or know the concept ‘roguelike’ from video games like Returnal, that is what we are talking about.

User summary:

The scenario is published as two PDF files:

98-page Scenario
20-page Handouts (print-and-play)

boardgame.name: Untold Sagas: Lore Book
boardgame.description:
Svilland Campaign Setting

From the introduction:

There is a land in Midgard where a hard people live out their days, standing tall against all that ails them; against harsh howling winds, rough living conditions, and the constant threat of Black Winter looming over them. The dvergrs, half-jotunns and humanoids of Svilland roam the kingdoms of Alsvartr, Nionaem, and Green Lights of the East, seeking to eliminate all signs of this winter threatening to bring an end to life as they know it. They lean on their faith in the Gods and Goddesses and long for the day where they shall stand beside them in the final battle of Ragnarok; some waiting to stand with Loki and his children, and some, with Odin and his pantheon. It is said that when Loki is released from his bounds; when Jormungandr defeats Thor, when Fenrir devours Odin, and when Hel walks Svilland with her army made of the dead and the undead at the end of Black Winter; it will be the end of all things.

However, these lands were not always as they are now. Located to the south of the site of the fabled Aesir-Vanir war, Svilland has been home to many kingdoms that have not survived to this day; each contributing to the mosaic that is Svilland as we know it with their own culture and background. This book seeks to act as a guide to the history of Svilland to the present, and to provide readers with information on these past kingdoms, along with all other elements that contribute to its unique structure.

boardgame.name: Raid! Word Game
boardgame.description:
Have you ever been stuck at a game night waiting and waiting for others to take their turn? Or played word games where the only words that came to mind are BORED or RAGE? What if you took that RAGE, built it back and made it GREAT? RAID's unique gameplay brings everyone together!

RAID is a fast-paced party game for players of all ages - it's great for adults who love word games and are uber-competitive, as well as more casual players and kids. There's even a second board on the reverse side where it’s easier to form words. RAID is perfect to encourage children to have fun with words and you get TWO games in ONE BOX!

One player rolls the dice and takes the number of letters indicated on the dice from the bag and places them face up in the circle for everyone to see. At a quick pace the next player does the same. As soon as any letters are in the circle, it’s everyone’s turn. To form a word you take letters from the circle. The first player to shout out a word grabs the letters and fits them on their board in one of their rows.

Anyone can steal or RAID any word from another player's board by combining it with one or more letters from the circle to form a new word. Note: the new word has to have a completely new meaning to be a valid RAID. New letters are constantly being added so be sure to look out for new opportunities on your road to victory.

There are several ways to win:
Be the first player to complete three rows in your field.
Be the player with the most points after a pre-agreed time limit.
Be the player with the most points after all the letters tiles have been drawn.

The RAID App is here for everyone and you can download it on your phone, tablet or personal computer right now!

boardgame.name: Haus des Geldes: Escape Game 2
boardgame.description:
After your sensational robbery of the Spanish banknote printing house, you now face a new challenge!
You have a double goal: steal the gold reserves of the Spanish National Bank and free Rio. Again the professor will guide you. So follow his instructions - and you will be rich and free!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Orbital Blues
boardgame.description:
A Space Western RPG

From the introduction:

It is an intergalactic age of cowboys, outlaws and bandits playing on an interstellar stage. It is a time of hyper-capitalism and a cut-throat gig economy. Unreliable trash-heaps carry scrappy underdogs to their next gig, and corporation freighters lumber across the horizon laden with an empire's bounty.
...
These are the music-fuelled, moonage daydreams of a rebel space age.

These are your Orbital Blues.

boardgame.name: À la Food Cart
boardgame.description:
Grab your aprons and sharpen your knives because the Food Cart Festival is in full swing! Sourcing the freshest ingredients and using innovative cooking techniques is how you stand out from the pack. Show everyone that you've got the chops to be the best roving restaurant on the block. You know what they say: if you can't stand the heat...

In à la food cart, players are racing to complete their selected Goal card first. Goals are completed by accumulating sets of ingredients each round, with players having the flexibility to choose different sets at any given time based on which areas of the card they wish to complete and which special abilities they seek to unlock.

During a round, both players will send their "workers" to the market by placing face-down cards covering the ingredients or actions they want to secure. By mixing their gains from the market with the Bonus effects active on their Goal card, players can create potent combos and advance toward victory.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

listing.notes: Also offering local pickup in Salt Lake City.

boardgame.name: An Unchained Melody
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the rock and roll future of yesteryear that never was - and nobody wanted.

It is an intergalactic age of cowboys, outlaws and bandits playing on an interstellar stage. It is a time of hypercapitalism and a cut-throat gig economy. Unreliable trashheaps carry scrappy underdogs to their next gig, and corporation freighters lumber across the horizon laden with an empire’s bounty.

The backstreets of every terraformed metropolis brim with a thousand lonely hearts and a thousand more venal vendettas. The burnt-out wastelands between bright lights are lawless back countries—anachronistic Americana languishing beneath multiple moons. Madness in every direction at every solar hour.

These are the music-fuelled, moon-age daydreams of a rebel space age.

These are your... ORBITAL BLUES

boardgame.name: Loyalty or Liberty?
boardgame.description:
An exciting and replayable LCG and War Game, combined!

It is the late seventeen seventies and the American War of Independence is in full swing. As cannons roar and muskets crackles across the east coast of the North American continent, armies of the Crown and Rebellion clash, and a decisive victory hangs in the balance.

Take command of one or more of as many as seven factions, each with their own traits and advantages as they vie for supremacy in a hypothetical scenario where terrain and unit lists change with each playthrough. Seize the initiative and dominate the field using a unique "Deployment" and "Lady Luck" card-driven system. Master the unique abilities of numerous officers and manipulate events across the battlefields, all while guiding myriad types of troops through varying terrain to victory, achieved by defeating the enemy on the field and raiding their base. Will the French rout the Germans from the field? Will the Loyalists tenaciously hold the line against their fellow Americans in a civil war of their own? Will the Spanish set out to dominate the Natives? Will Britannia reign supreme? It’s up to you, your opponent, and the dice and cards to find out!

boardgame.name: The Rogue Dead
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Disclaimer! The art for this one is a bit gruesome and the subject matter implies unjust death and revenge.

This is a one-page RPG for people who want to pay for crimes they never committed. You are a rogue and you did a job for your client. Instead of paying, they double-crossed you and killed you. It didn't take and revenge is in order.

A hack of Honey Heist by Grant Howitt.

boardgame.name: Trick Gear: Persona 5 The Royal
boardgame.description:
A fast paced, action, battle royale game where you face off against 1 to 3 opponents incorporating characters from the Persona video game's universe and power them up using any standard 54 deck of playing cards! Activate special skills and be the last one standing to win!

Players take turns drafting heroes (from the 17 character cards included in the box) that they will use to battle their opponents. Each player shuffles a 54 card standard playing card deck (sold separately) and draws a starting hand equal to the value printed on their current character. They also draw cards equal to that character's LIFE value. Players will then pick one card from their hand to represent their starting POWER (1-10 cards have power equivalent to their numbers, while Jacks, Queens and Kings equal a power value of 11,12 and 13 respectively).

Players then take turns playing different suits and numbered cards in specific combinations to activate their character's own unique battle skills. These skills will either allow you to charge up your current battle power value even further, increase the rate of damage dealt to losing players at the end of the round, or any number of special abilities (like drawing more cards or dealing instant damage to an opponent).

Once all players PASS, everyone counts up who has the current highest power value. That player wins that round, dealing damage to every other player, equivalent to the current rate of damage! Those players must discard life cards equal to the damage rate. If a hero loses all of it's health, that player must switch to one of their reserve heroes. When all of your opponents heroes have been reduced to 0 health, you win the game!

boardgame.name: Hellboy: The Dice Game
boardgame.description:
In Hellboy: The Dice Game, you take on the role of a B.P.R.D. recruit exploring a mysterious location. As a new recruit your abilities and resources are limited so you'll need your wits about you to try and survive. Push your luck to press deeper into the unknown or play it safe and live to fight another day. The choice is yours!

The game consists of a deck of cards representing rooms that contain monsters, clues, and encounters, and a set of dice (the same kind of dice that are used in Hellboy: The Board Game).

Players take turns trying to get through rooms and gather clues before getting knocked out.

On your turn, you start with all of the dice and draw a card. You choose which dice to roll (3 max) in order to overcome challenges (like monsters or hazards) and gain clues (victory points). Once you use a die, it can't be used again to overcome future rooms this turn. After defeating a room, you can either choose to pass, and keep all of the clues you've gained, or draw again. If you're defeated by the room, you lose all of the clues you've gained this turn and play passes to the next player.

The first player that gains at least 15 clues triggers the end of the game. Other players get one more turn to try to gather more clues. Player with the most clues wins.

boardgame.name: Testudinea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The city of Testudinea has crawled for eons.
Upon the colossal Turtle’s back the city has weathered through countless invasions and passed through many hands. Now a catastrophe looms on the horizon as the Turtle ceaselessly marches towards the ocean, ready to submerge the city beneath the waves. The downtrodden and overworked people cry out for help, but their lamentations fall upon the deaf ears of their rulers.

As disaster inches closer, will you help fight for a better future with the burgeoning new union The Dualies? Or will you reap profit from the vulnerable with the landlording Hyena Court?

Testudinea is a 34 page city setting for use in Troika!

6 new backgrounds.
5 syndicates carrying out their own agendas.
8 new enemies to encounter.
New spells and weapons.
36 random occurrences.
Neighborhoods to customize .
An ecological dilemma that threatens the entire city!

boardgame.name: Thousand Pound Canvas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Includes 36 new backgrounds compatible with the world's other favorite RPG, Troika! Play as the flakey Crumb Bum, the faithful Bouncing Disciple or the nearly useless Fail Child. All backgrounds have a unique flavor sure to fit in any of the spheres amongst the humped-backed sky.

Included also are several new spells and a couple of weapons along with useful info for the anomalous Thousand Pound Canvas; an immovable, countless layered painting which can transport players across time and space.

boardgame.name: The Cerulean Curtain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cerulean Curtain lifts...

Spend a night in the dreaming theater where words cut deep and blood seeps upon the stage! The Cerulean Curtain is a demisphere existing within the dreamscape, where entrapped Gladiators perform their wet work upon The Scarred Stage under the eyes of the pedantic Director!

Included in this 40 page adventurous setting is:

Random tables for creating 3 Act plays set for the stage.
A handful of random tables of items and mishaps.
A mini Hex Crawl & Point Crawl.
9 new enemies, including a unique Gladiator generator.
3 new Theatrical Combat Advanced Skills. Kill with your words!
4 new spells!
6 new backgrounds for use in any Troika game.


Delve into the mysteries of the theater, explore several areas of interest such as The Unconscious Pit where Gladiators devolve into forgotten sands, or The Set Betwixt, the labyrinthian domain of the Rope Ylves! Stretch your acting muscles upon The Scarred Stage belting soliloquies and skulls alike. Follow the visions of the Director to win your freedom, or rage against his dominion! But take caution, lest you forever lose aspects of yourself to The Cerulean Curtain...

boardgame.name: Kobold Craziness Part 3: Two Kobolds in a Trench Coat
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two kobolds in a trench coat need help finding their third member who appears to have vanished without a trace! Bryn Shander is a big place; he won’t be easy to find! Is his disappearance tied in with what has been happening to kobolds all across Icewind Dale?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

The third of four AL adventures in the Kobold Craziness Storyline.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Seal Team Sticks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A season 10 tier 1 adventure APL 3. Seed: Awake and Afraid

This title is a mystery module, where the characters help the townspeaker of Termalaine to figure out who is behind the unfortunate thefts happening in the town. If nothing is done, he will lose his job and the coming festival is ruined.

The adventure contains Investigation, talking animals and Aurora Borealis, what more do you want?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Put That Thing Right Back
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The long-awaited sequel to DC-PoA-CONMAR-01: Something Sinister

An ancient artifact is too dangerous to keep around. It needs to be stored securely for all
eternity. Do you dare to put it away?

Join a crazy ride across the ice of Frozenfar and dwelve into an ancient structure, with secrets and surprises galore!

A Four-Hour RP-heavy Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: 横道の書:反抗と解放の章
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

このコンテンツはすべて日本語で記述されています。

このサプリメントではレンジャーとパラディンそれぞれに1種類ずつサブクラスを記載している。

アルカナマク
このレンジャーの類型は魔術師達に従う狩人であり、魔術師達を追い詰める狩人である。
アルカナマクは狙う相手の魔術の一部を学び取り、呪文を通してより強力な力を刃に宿す。
解放の誓い
このパラディンの誓いは人々を圧政から解放し、自由のために戦う者たちの誓いである。
解放の誓いのパラディンは人々を縛る者を許さず、その歩みは誰にも止めることはできない。

boardgame.name: 横道の書:死と生命の章
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

このコンテンツはすべて日本語で記述されています。

このサプリメントではソーサラーとドルイドそれぞれに1種類ずつサブクラスを記載している。

流血の魔力
このソーサラーの血脈は血から力を引き出し、流血の中でこそ恐るべき力を奮う魔術師である。
流血の魔力のソーサラーは他者の血から生命力を盗み取り、血を贖いに危険な力を奮う。
冬枯れの円環
このドルイドの円環は自然のサイクルの一部である死を重視し、死から生を導く円環である。
冬枯れの円環のドルイドは終焉の寒々しさを手繰り寄せ、そして次の命を芽生えさせる。

boardgame.name: 横道の書:蛮性と高揚の章
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

このコンテンツはすべて日本語で記述されています。

このサプリメントではバードとバーバリアンそれぞれに1種類ずつサブクラスを記載している。

嵐を呼ぶ楽派
このバードの楽派は嵐によって霊感を授かり、荒々しい歌を響かせる楽派である。
嵐を呼ぶ楽派のバードは声援に嵐の力を込め、嵐の中にあるほどに力強くなる。
戦を導く者の道
このバーバリアンの原始の道はその威風によって人々を戦に駆り立てる道である。
戦を導く者の道のバーバリアンは仲間を勢いづかせ、痛みも忘れるほどの高揚を齎す。

boardgame.name: 横道の書:倣いと昇華の章
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

このコンテンツはすべて日本語で記述されています。

このサプリメントではモンクとウォーロックそれぞれに1種類ずつサブクラスを記載している。

竜爪門
このモンクの門派はドラゴンを手本として自らの武術の完成を目指す道である。
竜爪門のモンクは素手を武器として、竜を模した技で多数の相手と戦うことに長ける。
ドラゴンスピリット
このウォーロックのこの世ならぬ契約相手はかつて滅んだドラゴンたちの精髄である。
ドラゴンスピリットと契約したウォーロックは竜のブレスを怪光線に宿し、やがては竜に変化するようになる。

boardgame.name: Lost & Found SRD
Lost & Found System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Lost & Found system produces solo games telling the story of an Object over a long stretch of time, typically from its creation to destruction.

The story is told from the perspective of the Object itself, not those who use it. Player choices over the flow of the game will introduce characters and events, providing prompts that aim to inspire and constrain the story in interesting ways. However, the characters introduced through play are always transient within the long view of the Object.

boardgame.name: Are You More Like
boardgame.description:
Are You More Like is a hilarious party game that lets you see just how well your friends and family know you! (It is also a fantastic get to know you game for a first date)

First the Active Player is selected. Then, all other players look at their cards in hand and choose a number of cards to play face down in the middle based on the Quick Start Chart. Then if needed, add cards from the deck until there are at least 5 cards in the middle (again see the Quick Start Chart).

After all cards are submitted, the Active Player mixes the cards up and turns them over face up and puts them in a row. The Active Player will then secretly choose from the options which one they personally are “Most Like” AND which one they are “Least Like” and write it down. (Note: This is NOT which one do you like the most? It is which one are you most like?) At the same time all other players are secretly writing down what they predict the active player will choose for Most and Least about themselves.

Once all players have made their decisions, all non-active players reveal their choices at the same time by placing their (Most Token) and (Least Token) below each of the respectively chosen cards. The Active Player will then place their (Most Token) and (Least Token) above each respectively chosen card.

Scoring Points:
One point is awarded to each person who:
Correctly guessed the Active Player’s “Most Like” choice,
Correct guessed the Active Player’s “Least Like” choice,
Submitted the card that the active player selected as “Most Like”
Submitted the card that the active player selected as “Least Like”

After points are awarded, discard the cards from the middle, everyone restocks their hand to five cards and the next player become the Active Player.

The points needed to win varies on based on number of players.

boardgame.name: Сибирь. Начало. (Siberia: The Beginning)
boardgame.description:
Siberia. The Beginning is a game for 2-4 players who are interested in being in the role of the conqueror of Siberia in the 18th century. Explore new territories with your squad, find treasures, build churches and forts, establish settlements and fight enemies! Become a real ruler of the Siberian land!

Taking turns exposing from the starting field and mastering the tiles of the map of the lands of Siberia, the players move their meeples along it so that their location on the map objects meets the requirements of various tasks. At the end of each turn, the player must try to complete one or more tasks of his choice.
Each completed mission earns the player victory points.

The winner of the game is the one who scores the most points at the end of the game - and proves his right to rule the Siberian land.

boardgame.name: Vindication: The Archive of the Ancients
boardgame.description:
The Archive of the Ancients is a massive upgrade to Vindication that introduces loads of new quality-of-life content, including a huge box that holds darn near everything and has room for future content as well. The Archive includes:


Single-box storage solution — holds everything ever made (except the neoprene board)
Unified rulebook — all expansion and module content collected in a single master rulebook
Brand new Game Trayz storage system for all released content
Expanded colored personal player trays with room for all expansion content
Illustrated card boxes
Card dividers, each with various orientations for maximum customization
5 new action trackers in dual-layered 3mm blackcore foamboard with thick wooden discs


The Archive fits in Kallax shelving, and has plenty of space for sleeved cards.

boardgame.name: The Death of the Irish Gods
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Íth, first of the Gaelic peoples, saw Ireland from his fathers tower. Now, he and his men have landed to see what discoveries exist in this Emerald Isle. The Tuatha De Danaan, and their three kings, at first welcome you as visitors. But soon, suspicions grow that these ancient peoples have other plans for Íth and you, his retinue.

Quickly, a royal welcome to this last land of the gods becomes a nightmare from which Íth and you, his captains, doubt you will survive. As the gods' and their will bend ever more to your destruction, you face a fight or flee decision – both which may prove fruitless in the endgame.

boardgame.name: The Sanguine Cross
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

20 years ago Bishop Capellini signed a deal with infernal powers to cease being a poor friar and rise to one day rule the entire Catholic Church. Shortly after that, a freak storm slew his superior, the Bishop of Brescia, and to everyone’s surprise, Capellini was selected to assume the now vacant position. After carefully manipulating the politics of the time, along with subtle aid from unknown benefactors, he was next in position to assume the role of Cardinal Bishop of the commune of Albano.

boardgame.name: Drogheda: The Bog Witch
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Bog Witch is a supernatural horror story of revenge and hidden crimes. Set in the county of Meath, Ireland in 1348 A.D., or the action could take place in any historical village near a bog, or one of the Storyteller’s own creation.

boardgame.name: Alchemists, Bishops and Courtesans, oh my!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A cocky young noble, his tutor, a beautiful courtesan, an alchemist's apprentice, a struggling artist and a merchant wanted for murder. All of their destinies become entwined when Edmundo Brunetti, the eccentric Alchemist and scholar is abducted and a they are embroiled in a dangerous conspiracy and forced to enter a world of arcane lore, mysteries and sinister bankers: set against the back-drop of Florence at the height of the Italian Renaissance.

boardgame.name: The Crystal Wars
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Recover an Atlantean power crystal and return to the world.

boardgame.name: Smoke Filled the Room
boardgame.description:
From the description:

"Smoke Filled The Room" is an adventure written to be compatible with MORK BORG, & inspired by the album 'Smoke Filled The Room, We Slept' by Mellow Grave.

This adventure references official MORK BORG and MORK BORG Cult content. It’s relatively simple and well suited for improvisational play. If you have access to a music streaming service, the album referenced will heighten the experience.

boardgame.name: Landlocked Buccaneer
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Once a seafaring, deck swabbing, swashbuckling rover. Now, a defanged murderwhale, a barnacle torn from hull. In your dreams, you feel the salt in your eyes, the savory taste of the ship rats, and the pull of the monsters below.

In your nightmares, the very same things.

boardgame.name: The Royal Inscription of Xerxes at Persepolis: The Curse of Athena
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For ages, Poseidon and Athena had been rivals for the attentions of the people of Athens, Poseidon offering the people a spring of water, and Athena offering them an olive tree. The people chose the gift of Athena making her the patron of the city. Ever since, Poseidon has brooded over his loss.

One day, the sea nymph Medusae, who was the most beautiful of the three Gorgon sisters, was courted by the god Poseidon. She ran away from him and hid in the temple of Athena in the Acropolis at Athens. There, the god caught her and raped her on the floor of the temple. When Athena discovered this, she cursed Medusae, turning her into a hideous monster and banishing her to a lonely island.

boardgame.name: d66 People from Your Past
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This random table allows you to populate your world or backstory with some NPCs who have a vested interest in your PC(s) ... but almost certainly not with good intentions. Antagonists and rivals are better than friends, though, right? Created with Mörk Borg in mind, but it's usable with any grim/dark fantasy setting.

boardgame.name: The Haunted Island
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Spanish adventurer Juan Pablo Fernández de Calderón García-Iglesias has Discovered a map leading to an ancient Mayan city on an island in the Caribbean. A fortune in gold And jewels awaits the first to discover it.

boardgame.name: The Inheritor: A Failed-Squire Class
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This MÖRK BORG compatible class is inspired by Fantasy tropes of sun zealots, as well as knights training squires to replace them. How would they fare when no one's seen the sun in living memory? Inherit an ancient tradition snuffed out by darkness. There can be no greatness without sunlight. Only despair.

boardgame.name: The Skull Tree
boardgame.description:
A Fantasy Imperium Adventure in 1690 Pennsylvania

From the introduction:

The Skull Tree is a story about people and how they can let their fears get the better of them. It takes place in the small village of Hope, somewhere in South Central Penn’s Woods (Pennsylvania) in 1690. In this story, a small group of townsfolk confront their fears and solve the mystery, or their fears get the better of them and they succumb to the power of supposition.

boardgame.name: The Vale of Stinking Fur
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The jungle is a symphony. Underbrush squelches beneath your feet. Vines writhe and twist on the trees beside you, or are they snakes? Birds sing their absent songs up above, crooning with human tongues not spoken in an age.

There is a howl in the dark. You are all alone out here. An interloper trespassing in territory not meant for homo sapiens. The howls grow louder. There is the banging of sticks on trunks, unseen in the canopy, the chorus of a warpath headed right for you.

The doom-apes are coming for you. Will you be eaten?

Or will you escape the vale?

This hexcrawl is dedicated to all the Monkeys that ignore the player characters of MÖRK BORG but love them anyways. Even when they get a flail to the face or end up in the belly of a Gutworm.

boardgame.name: The Tyrant Queen
boardgame.description:
A Fantasy Imperium Adventure in 1690 Pennsylvania

From the introduction:

Located on the Aegean Sea two hundred miles southwest of Greece, a land mass larger that Asia Minor and Lybya combined, there is a glitteringkingdom of gold-encrusted streets, great crystal palaces and with a vast harbor crowded with tall ships designed to cross trade routes around the globe. Ruled by King Alonar, a weak monarch totally dominated by his queen, Evilla.

boardgame.name: Whispers of Raziel
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Jerusalem is in an uproar, buildings burn and the temple is being attacked by Roman soldiers who, learning of a loss of pay from Rome upon the new Emperor’s ascension decide to compensate themselves with treasures from the Temple of the Hebrews.

Amidst the uproar, every faction of Jewish faith and followers of competing religions take the chance to settle their debts with enemies in the streets of the Holy City.

But beneath the city, in one of the many crypts where heretics, zealots and sub-sects of faith meet in secret, a group of Rabbinic mystics hold a regular meeting to practice the Jewish art of Merkava – the meditation on the Wheel of Ezekial.

Four old men open their eyes from the state of contemplation, as the ceiling of the crypt shakes. Each has had a vision of the angel Raziel. Into each of your ears he has whispered a secret of things that are to come, revelations, and the hint of what you must each do if you are to fulfill your tikkun, your destiny.

boardgame.name: World of Darkness Add-on: Urban Shadows
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This world is one of horror, corruption, violence, and dark mystery; a world of shadows within shadows.
...
This is a direct add-on to Urban Shadows, an Apocalypse World hack, created by Andrew Medeiros. Our goal was to not make a direct a copy of World of Darkness, but to make the overall theme of Urban Shadows a few steps closer towards that of WoD.

boardgame.name: World of Darkness for Urban Shadows
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a direct add-on to Urban Shadows, an Apocalypse World hack, created by Andrew Medeiros. Our goal was not to make a direct a copy of World of Darkness (WoD), but to make the overall theme of Urban Shadows many steps closer towards that of WoD. Many of the abilities and powers are not exact representations of their exact selves within the WoD text, but we have crafted abilities that create a balance between the intentions of Urban Shadows and Apocalypse World.

boardgame.name: Dosdediez (Número 3 - Feb 1998)
boardgame.description:
Dosdediez
Número 3

Febrero 1998

boardgame.name: Mox's Marvelous Guide to Magical Potions
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Mox the kobold paladin considers themself to be an adventuring expert. After all, they graduated to of their class in their "So You Want to Be A Paladin" correspondence course and have days of experience under their belt.

So they decided to share this expertise, in the form of a small book that details their experiences with these unusual concoctions.

Each potion includes a graphic, 5e compatible rules for use, and Mox's story of their testing experiences.

boardgame.name: Mox's Marvelous Guide to Magical Books
boardgame.description:
From the description:

11 New Books to Inform and Assist Players Of 5e Compatible Games, By Mox The Kobold Paladin, As Told To Aaron “Crash” Smith

Mox the kobold paladin returns, with a new 5e compatible supplement to help round out the loot tables for DMs and GMs everywhere!

Each "book" described within includes a graphic, 5e compatible rules for use, and Mox's story of their literary experiences with the tome in question.

boardgame.name: Beneath the Fairy Tree
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Festival of Lights is three days away, but the halflings of Hilltop Grove have a serious problem. The Fairy Tree and their beloved dryad have fallen ill. Without them, the festival is in jeopardy.

This 5e adventure is designed to be played by level 1 characters in about 3 hours depending on the size and experience of your group and how engaged they get with the social parts. There is a minimal amount of combat and an effort has been made to give options to avoid some of the combat while still giving them an opportunity to sling some dice and use their character abilities. If you need inspiration for the intended themes, look to Netflix's The Dragon Prince or Studio Ghibli movies like Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind.

boardgame.name: Little Garden
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Made for the Solarpunk Jam, Little Garden is a game about decline, corruption and the impossibility of a lasting utopia.

Play as Nomes, helpful garden Spirits, trying to maintain their home after the absence of the Garden's creator, fight back dangerous beasts, vagrants from the encroach wilds and tend to the animals and other denizens that make their home with you. At least, for as long as you can that is.

boardgame.name: Hong Kong (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description:
Ticket to Ride™: Hong Kong is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride™ series created by Alan R. Moon. A tribute both to Ticket to Ride™ and to Hong Kong, this expansion is designed for players who are already well familiar with Ticket to Ride™’s standard gameplay and mechanics.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or play tested this expansion.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 – Team Asia & Legendary Asia

boardgame.name: Seeders from Sereis: Exodus -Taïs
boardgame.description: The Taïs expansion puts a focus on the Deviant faction of Sereïs. It adds asymmetric gameplay, the option to play with a 5th player and 4 scenarios for Deviants. A booklet tells an episode from the life of one deviant character, Taïs.

boardgame.name: Seeders from Sereis: Exodus – Etho
boardgame.description: The Etho expansion puts a focus on the Theocrate faction of Sereïs. It adds asymmetric gameplay, the option to play with a 5th player and 4 scenarios for Theocrates. A booklet tells an episode from the life of one Theocrat character, Etho.

boardgame.name: Seeders from Sereis: Exodus – Hank's
boardgame.description: The Hank's expansion introduces the new Quincailleurs class of Sereïs. It adds asymmetric gameplay, 26 new Ark cards and 4 scenarios that use them. A booklet tells an episode from the life of one Quincailleur character, Hank.

boardgame.name: Final Challenge: Twisted Expansion
boardgame.description: Twisted expansion contains challenges, scenarios and art that is weird, unusual and out of the ordinary. There will be magic, creativity, fantasy and just plain bizarre moments that will make you scratch your head.

boardgame.name: Dreimal Darfst Du Raten
boardgame.description:
Dreimal Darfst Du Raten (english you got three guesses) is a entertaining game and is played with teams of at least two members.

Players take turns to describe a specific phrase to their partners until the stack of 20 cards is divided to the team that correctly guessed. After the points are noted, the 20 cards are shuffled together to start another round with different ruling up to three rounds.

First Round:
Only use words, expect words that are in the phrase, to describe the phrases.

Second Round:
Only use gestures to describe the phrases.

Third Round:
Only use sounds to describe the phrases.

The team with the most guesses in summed in all rounds win.

boardgame.name: Final Challenge: Rated R
boardgame.description: Hide the kids, hide the elderly, send the easily offended and sensitive friends back home, because the content of the Rated R expansion really packs a punch. It’s cringe worthy, hilarious, and borderline unmanageable.

boardgame.name: Bardwood Grove
boardgame.description:
Bardwood Grove is a tableau-composition euro game where each player assumes the role of a fantastical Bard. Set in The Five Realms universe (Merchants Cove, Rise to Nobility, Cavern Tavern), players will adventure to the Halfling Realm, the home to the finest, highly-talented, and most-legendary Bards of all the land.

As Bards, players will manage a unique tempo dial mechanism to build temporary Song tableaus from your deck, while exploring and activating locations around the lush woodland city. Each Bard starts with asymmetric skill decks that match their style, such as the Bardbarian, Sword Dancer, and Wardrummer. Learn new Bardic skills, tell tales and perform gigs, soothe the dissonant creatures invading the Grove, and contend with other Bards for the most Glory and Fame. Once all Glory has been collected, the Bard with the most combined Glory and Fame wins!

Each turn, players draw two cards from their unique skill deck and play one to their Story (discard pile) for instant benefits, while the other is added to their Song (tableau). Bardwood Grove challenges players to carefully craft their Song tableaus, coordinating them with their Composition cycle that governs how frequently they sing. As players strategically use resources to upgrade their decks, Songs will release powerful combos and allow players to interact with multiple locations. This creates a unique ebb and flow to the game, as players build their songs, and then decide when and where to sing them.

Rumor has it that Bardwood Grove is full of hidden secrets. As the game is played and decisions are made, players will unlock content and evolve the game naturally. An achievement system tied to the choices and performances of each game will guide players through a series of unlockable content. As new content emerges through each play, the game will provide players with new content that is based on unique outcomes and player decisions. Grove locations will change, additional Bardic skills can be unlocked, Bard decks become more powerful, new Bards arrive in town, and a variety of characters (both good and bad) can enter the game.

Unravel the mysteries of Bardwood Grove!

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q3 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Exclusive Bardwood Grove: Collector's Edition Board Game by Final Frontier Games. Includes core board game, deluxe upgrade pack, KS Exclusive Pack, Spirits of the Grove Expansion, Set of 30 metal coins, and all unlocked stretch goals. Order this Board Game now and Get FREE SHIPPING in the Continental US! Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Das Quiz der Erde
boardgame.description: In this quiz game, each player gets 7 question cards from 7 categories. The answers are contained in an enclosed book. The player whose turn it is reads out one of his questions and must answer it himself (according to the specification on the card) or address it to all the players. Correctly answered individual questions score 1 point, the general questions score 2 points. The player who scores the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Maze of the Screaming Heads
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ninety-seven years ago the Cult of Malphas created the greatest library of Arcane Lore ever collected : the Maze of Yes'od-caj. They invited Sages and Luminaries from all over to witness its consecration.

When the guests arrived, the cultists set upon them, beheading every sage and trapping their minds inside their undead skulls to serve as the source of the library's lore.

One sage avoided the slaughter and took revenge, poisoning the Cult with a killing spell, sealing the library to all but himself.

Now, a century later, the doors to Yes'od-caj are open, and something stalks the streets, collecting the heads of the wise and holy...

And there is Forbidden Lore and lost treasure ripe for the taking...

Maze of the Screaming Heads is an adventure module for an OSR-compatible adventure game and structured for 3-5 PCs of levels 5-7. It was made using the 1991 Cyclopedia for one of the original rulesets that inspired the OSR. It is ideal for play in Labyrinth Lord, Old-School Essentials, or Lamentations of the Flame Princess.

This adventure takes place in a Maze-like crypt full of insane undead heads whose babble provides constant distraction, leaving Player Characters vulnerable to surprise by monsters that use hit-and-run tactics to whittle them down.

To escape the dungeon once trapped inside the PCs must either make an unholy alliance with an undead cultist, find the needed clues for the puzzle by finding the few sane heads, slay a deadly monster, or sell their souls to a Demon Prince. This adventure offers multiple ways out for different play styles. Characters can talk, think, or fight their way out as they choose.

The Maze of the Screaming Heads makes heavy use of environmental hazards.

The module contains a little over 45,000 gp worth of treasure. Much of this comes in the form of valuable lore and delicate crumbling books. It may be difficult for PCs to even recognize some of the treasures of the dungeon as such. In all likelihood, they will find only a fraction of this wealth.

The PCs may also earn up to 14,720 xp from monsters across eight encounters.

All told, this is not quite enough potential experience for 6th level Thieves or Clerics to gain a level, and less than half what a Magic-User might need, even if the PCs are painstaking in looting the dungeon.

This adventure module is intended as satire, any resemblance to a social network or particular online community may be intentional… but I'm not telling which ones for sure.

boardgame.name: Meeple Hope
boardgame.description:
It's the end of the world! Your planet MEEPLE EARTH is dying. After years of exploiting its last resources, your people (the Meeples) are headed for extinction. In order to survive this they have created the Meeple Hope program as a last resort. Several rockets are sent into space, allowing a few lucky ones to survive and search of a new home. Today the last Meeple Hope rocket is ready to take off, but unfortunately there won't be room for everyone. All bets are off in the boarding line to try to get aboard the rocket and leave the dying planet.

Try to get all your meeples into the rocket before your opponents. The first player to get all his meeples into the rocket wins the game! To do this, players must take turns, using cards, to try to predict how the queue will progress. Each player has identical cards, so you will be able to apprehend or constrain the movements of your opponents.

The game plays roughly like Colt Express: each player has the same six cards in hand, at their turn, they play one card (face up) on the Programming Deck. Once each player has played three cards, these cards are revealed one by one and resolved. The players do the same with their three remaining cards. They get their six cards back and begin a new round if the end of game condition is not met.

A player wins if they are the first to reach the rocket with all their meeples.

Solo mode included: Program against a virtual player
Program character configurations in the waiting line, in successive challenges.

The original cards in German

The Randomizer Box is a HUGE collection of cards for use by gamers and Game Masters in board games and tabletop roleplaying games. The box you hold in your hands contains everything that is necessary for a comfortable game session.
...

You do not need to have a copy of any of the Cartaventura games (Lhassa, Vinland, or Oklahoma) to play this mini scenario.

boardgame.name: Get Bit! Feeding Frenzy: The Sharkspansion
boardgame.description:
Get Bit! Feeding Frenzy: The Sharkspansion expands Get Bit! in two ways:

• Item cards: Players can use items that have been lost at sea to get away from the shark — or at least get away from the other players.

• Shark cards: Instead of mindlessly chomping on the last swimmer in the line, the shark is now a playable character. Can you outthink the others to keep your belly full?

boardgame.name: 18 India
boardgame.description:
India's railroad history began in 1837 when The Red Hill Railway used the country's first steam-powered locomotive to carry stone for road work to Madras, modern-day Chennai. In 1845, India's first railway was incorporated, the Madras Railway. Sixteen years later, on a warm April day in 1853, a 14-carriage train carrying 400 passengers was hauled 21 miles by three steam locomotives - the Sahib, Sindh, and Sultan - and passenger railway service was thus initiated in India. From there, as they say, the rest is history, and India today has the world's fourth-largest railway network.

18 India is an operational railroad game for 2 to 5 people that plays in about 3 hours. The game is inspired by 1829 Mainline by Francis Tresham, and while the venerable Mr. Tresham created some novel mechanics for that game, many of them are not ideal for players that eschew in-game randomness. In 18 India, those random elements are transformed into an amazing level of pre-game variability, which gives each session of the game a different character.
