boardgame.name: Treeblox
boardgame.description:
Treeblox is an abstract strategy board game in which two trees compete for sunlight in three-dimensional space.

The game starts with an empty board. Players then take turns placing cubes that represent leaves and branches. Unshaded leaves — that is, leaves that are visible when the board is viewed from above — count as active and supply their tree with energy to grow further. Your goal is to shade your opponent's leaves while keeping your own leaves open to the sun.

Each player starts with one leaf in a space on the 4x4 game board. On a turn, if you have 1-2 unshaded leaves, you place one piece on the board, whether a branch or a leaf; if you have three or more unshaded leaves, then you place up to two pieces. You can place nothing in a leaf, so a leaf serves as an endpoint for growth. If you place a branch, however, then you can add a branch or a leaf to any available side of that branch. You can have multiple branches growing on the game board, and the branches and leaves can extend outside of the 4x4 game board. If you build high enough, you can shade an opponent's leaves.

When a player has placed their final piece, whether because they've placed everything or they have no legal placements available, the other player goes through a "final growth" phase in which they place everything they can. At that point, whoever has the most unshaded leaves wins. If you ever have zero unshaded leaves during play, you lose immediately.

boardgame.name: Wasteland Wanderers (2nd Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wasteland Wanderers has mutated! Wasteland Wanderers 2nd Edition is bigger, badder, and better than ever!

Wasteland Wanderers is stuffed full of player-facing content including species, classes, backgrounds, feats, and more. Although designed for use in post-apocalyptic campaign settings, a lot of the content within can be utilised in modern, science-fiction, and in some cases even fantasy worlds with minimal to no conversion effort.


Start a new life in the post-apocalyptic wastes.

Wasteland Wanderers includes ten playable species, as well as sixteen possible sub-species!

The species within include:

Humans are found everywhere in the wasteland but are no longer dominant. They can come from a number of origins: Bunker Buddies and Bunker Survivors emerge from protective bunkers into the wasteland, while Wastelanders are born in the ashes of the old world.
Bantamites are humanoids who mutated over generations to become a shorter, sturdily-built people.
Biosynths are artificial humanoids created by a mysterious organisation to spy on the people of the wasteland.
Cats are beasts which make for affectionate if sometimes fickle friends. Sub-species include the Wasteland Cat and the Experimental Cat.
Dearg Dubh are mutant humanoids who resemble vampires of legend.
Dogs are beasts that can be loyal companions to other wasteland wanderers. Sub-species include the Hound, the Ogre Hound, and the Experimental Hound.
Morlocks are mutant humanoids who evolved through a combination of radiation exposure and generations of living in the dark.
Ogres are powerful mutant humanoids originally created in experiments to make a super soldier.
Robots are machines designed to perform tasks assigned by their creators, but who may now be living an independent existence in the wasteland. Models include the Butlerbot, the Commbot, the Furson, the Mr/Mrs Helper, the Private Helper, the Protectorbot, the Securibot, and the Gen 5 Synthbot.
Rotters are humans who have mutated into ghoulish husks after somehow surviving severe or repeated radiation exposure.




Bring a touch of class to a savage world.

Wasteland Wanderers presents six reimagined, reworked, and original classes designed to suit Post-Apocalyptic worlds. The second edition revitalises these classes with updated features, starting equipment packages (for those who also own Wasteland Wares), and 4 archetypes each - except the Soldier, which has 5!

The classes and archetypes within include:

The Savage, a class based on the SRD's Barbarian with post-apocalyptic appropriate archetypes including the Berserker, the Bulletstormer, the Implacable Hunter, and the Survivor.
The Scientist, a new class which focuses on intellect and expertise. Archetypes include theBotanist, the Chem Cook, the Engineer, and the Programmer.
The Scoundrel, a class based on the SRD's Rogue with post-apocalyptic appropriate archetypes including the Con Artist, the Killer, the Rooftop Runner, and a nonmagical variant of the Thief.
The Scout, a new class that fills a niche similar to the SRD's Ranger. These wilderness experts rely on their Instinct to enhance their fortunes, and wield a signature weapon known as their Old Reliable. Archetypes include the Avenger, the Beast Hunter, the Bounty Hunter, and the Guerilla.
The Shepherd, a new class that fills a niche similar to the SRD's Bard. They are political leaders, officers, and similar inspiring figures. Archetypes include the Chronicler, the Commander, the Regent, and the Tyrant.
The Soldier, a class based on the SRD's Fighter with post-apocalyptic appropriate archetypes including the Brawler, the Champion, the Heavy, the Pit Fighter, and the Sharpshooter.




Develop and customize your wastelander.

Wasteland Wanderers provides numerous other options for building your character, including:

New skill and tool proficiencies
15 backgrounds, including the Caravanner, Bunker-Born, Con Artist, Courier, Criminal, Doctor, Follower, Orphan, Performer, Raider, Researcher, Scholar, Tribefolk, Underground Agent, and Veteran.
41 feats




The wasteland plays by its own rules.

Wasteland Wanderers includes appendices describing new supplemental rules that might apply to your character, including:

Rules for Luck
Rules for Radiation
Rules for Starvation and Dehydration

boardgame.name: Wasteland Wares (2nd Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Wasteland Wares has mutated! Wasteland Wares 2nd Edition is bigger, badder, and better than ever!

Wasteland Wares is crammed full of content, including a large variety of equipment, new player options, and a host of rules aimed at facilitation post-apocalyptic play. Although designed for use in post-apocalyptic campaign settings, a lot of the content within can be utilised in modern, science-fiction, and in some cases even fantasy worlds with minimal to no conversion effort.


A compendium of riches and rust.

The primary function of Wasteland Wares is to act an inventory of post-apocalyptic equipment and rules supporting their use in your homebrew campaign worlds and pre-published settings. You could also use much of the content in other kinds of futuristic setting.

Wasteland Wares contains:

Guidance on the Wasteland economy, power sources, damage types, and resource scarcity.
Rules for crafting and repairs.
Lists of armour, power armour, weapons, armour and weapon modifications, explosives, ammunition, and masses of miscellaneous gear.
Chems (drugs) and optional rules for addiction.
Food, drink, and alcohol, as well as rules for sustenance and drunkenness.
A table of Wasteland trinkets.
Descriptions and costs for various service industries, trade goods, and livestock that might be available in the wasteland.
A selection of robot statblocks.
Rules for cybernetics enhancements and implants.
Weird properties you can add to weapons and armour.
Rules for handling radiation, ammo tracking, equipment breakdowns, and randomly generating loot.




New post-apocalyptic paths!

Wasteland Wares now includes a selection of player options designed to supplement the character options in Wasteland Wanderers! The new options available are themed around service, and would be excellent choices for wastelanders who have made or continue to make a living as wasteland merchants.

These options include:

A brand new class, the Sidekick, which aims to support and bring out the best in its allies. Archetypes include the Apprentice, the Attendant, the Chef, and the Expert.
The Enforcer, a new archetype for the Savage.
The Sawbones, a new archetype for the Scoundrel.
The Messenger, a new archetype for the Scout.
The Trader, a new archetype for the Shepherd.
The Guardian, a new archetype for the Soldier.

boardgame.name: Wasteland Wheels
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wasteland Wheels roars onto the scene!

Wasteland Wheels provides everything you need to add vehicles and vehicle encounters to your post-apocalyptic or modern era campaign. Inside you'll find not just vehicle statblocks and rules, but also new player options, and an optional deck of cards designed to add more excitement to vehicle encounters.


Start your engines!
Wasteland Wheels is all about vehicles. As well as a large number of example vehicle statblocks and all the rules you need to use them, this book also includes new player options which engage with the rules within. Though these rules support post-apocalyptic campaign worlds first and foremost, you could also use them in a modern era setting or adapt them to a more futuristic campaign.

Wasteland Wheels contains:

7 new archetypes: one each for the Savage, Scientist, Scoundrel, Scout, Shepherd, and Soldier classes (these classes are found in Wasteland Wanderers), plus one for the Sidekick class (found in Wasteland Wares).
Rules for using vehicles in your games.
A vehicle modification subsystem.
Rules for crafting and repairing vehicle mods and vehicles.
41 vehicle statblocks, including civilian and military vehicles for the following environments: land, air, water, and underwater.
Optional vehicle card rules, including a deck of vehicle cards to print at home.

boardgame.name: Choose Your Weapon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:



A warrior's most trusty companion is their weapon! Is yours letting you down?
There are plenty of weapons to choose in the 5e game, but far fewer that most players want to choose. Some aren't attractive because of their low damage, especially if you're playing a martial class. Others suffer by being outclassed by another similar weapon. Choose Your Weapon presents an alternative approach which is designed to even the playing field, enhancing the appeal of previously neglected weapons. You can even use the system to create entirely new weapons, either drawing inspiration from antiquity or your favourite media, or perhaps plucking an idea straight from your own imagination.


Heroic Damage Dice

Each character is assigned a heroic damage die, initially determined by their first class choice and potentially growing as they multiclass. The more martially oriented your character, the higher your heroic damage die. It becomes the baseline for damage your character deals with any weapon in their hands.


Weapon Properties

Every weapon the character wields is represented by a selection of properties. There's a trade off for particularly useful properties, which each reduce your damage with the weapon. Similarly, properties that represent drawbacks can increase your damage to compensate. The end result is some weapons still deal more damage than others, but the lower damage weapons are always more useful tactically.

Your character's damage with any weapon they wield is their heroic damage die adjusted by the weapon's properties, so a warrior will always deal more damage than a wizard would with the same weapon.


Wield any Weapon

Since Choose Your Weapon makes all weapons equal, the concept of simple and martial weapon proficiencies becomes redundant. As a consequence, any character from any class can wield any weapon (they'll just do more or less damage depending on their heroic weapon die - being able to wield a weapon isn't the same as being able to wield it well). Want to be a wizard with a scimitar? Got you covered! A rogue with a greataxe? Sure thing! A cleric with a glaive? Nothing's stopping you! You can even use the rules to make up a new weapon for your character, perhaps even an unusual and iconic item: how about a Knowledge Cleric with an iron-bound tome, or a Storm Herald Barbarian who wields an anchor?

boardgame.name: Monstrous Monograph: Undead Volume I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing the Monstrous Monograph, a growing collection of monsters with which Fifth Edition game masters can challenge their players.

Each volume of the Monstrous Monograph presents a handful of creatures of a given monster type. Grow your collection a few monsters at a time for far less than the price of your morning coffee!

Monstrous Monograph: Undead Vol. I contains four new monster, and six statblocks:

The CR 3 Alley Ghast and CR 6 Alley Ghast Survivor are a variant form of ghast which possess far greater cunning. They dwell in hidden corners of towns and cities, emerging at night to prey on the vulnerable and forgotten. Alley ghasts prefer a solitary existence but in times when prey is bountiful they sometimes emerge as the leader of local ghoul packs.
When a ghoul feasts on a recent battlefield or from a mass grave, they can evolved into the CR 7 Battlegorged Ghoul. The spirits of all the restless dead whose bodies they consumed are absorbed into them, and the battlegorged ghoul can regurgitate them as specters which must do its bidding.
The CR 4 Bone Keeper is a type of skeleton created to guard necromancers and other powerful undead. A skeletal torso, Bone Keepers float behind the creature they're protecting and use their elongated arms to provide cover to their ward.
The CR 2 Lifeleech Skeleton is a more powerful variant of skeleton that can drain life energy with a touch, and emits a necrotic aura that is deadly to living creatures it approaches.

boardgame.name: Hibachi: Fried Egg promo
boardgame.description:
Each round, before players throw any chips onto the board, the current head chef throws the egg chip onto the board. Then players will begin throwing their chips on the board as normal, starting with the head chef.

Any chips sitting on the same spot as the egg at the commencement of the Cleaning the Cooking Area phase are removed from the board and the space is not resolved this round!

boardgame.name: Rival Rogues
boardgame.description:
As a talented and devious rogue you know that this high level job requires the best equipment. Gather the necessary materials, but be quick! Or someone else will beat you to the treasure!

Create your equipment by combining needed materials, but watch out for the monsters and trap cards hiding in the material deck! Be the first to craft 3 equipment cards and maintain the most points by the end of the round to win the game.

On the start of your turn you have three actions to complete: Draw 1 Card from any three decks ; Play 1 action card ; Play your subclass ; Complete an equipment card.

The last round of the game is started when a person plays their third equipment card, symbolizing their desire to complete the job. The game ends on the turn of the person who went last on the starting round.

To win the game and complete the job, be the first to complete 3 equipment cards and maintain the most points by the end of the round! Points are +1 for each complete equipment card and an additional +1 for every special equipment that matches your role.

If the player only completes two cards and ties in points with the person that ended the game, the person who ended the game wins. All other ties are settled by an added speed round. The top equipment card is flipped up and the tied players take turns as normal trying to complete that equipment card. Resolve Monsters, Traps, and other actions cards as normal, but remove the equipment and role deck.

boardgame.name: Growers and Showers
boardgame.description:
What do you get if you combine Exploding Kittens with Cards Against Humanity and Bears Vs Babies?

Growers and Showers is a tactical card game about sex and relationships. The decks are full of inappropriate cards, from porn categories and contraceptives to sexual orientations and kinks. Players use these cards to grow the biggest Dick, before their friend cuts it off!

As the game intensifies, players have to choose whether they want to use their cards to grow a bigger Dick early and protect it (Showers) or slowly catch up and steal a win at the last (Growers). Once the Decks are depleted, the game ends and the biggest Dick wins.

A turn consists of 2 moves. On a move, you play a card from your hand and discard it in the process. These moves can consist of 1 card or more depending on the type of card. Hands must be replenished between moves, so that every hand has the minimum number of cards (7).

When all the cards are depleted from the Decks, the game ends immediately.

Initially, a player will have to have the biggest Grower. If the Missionary cards have been played during the game then the aim of the game could have been changed to smallest Grower or most cards on your Grower.

boardgame.name: Lure of the Reefs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part 1 of the Hunters of the Sea Trilogy

Ships have disappeared amongst the Norheim Islands, almost all of them carrying refugees from Norland. An expedition, sent to find the cause, has similarly vanished without a trace. Most blame lack of experience with the treacherous local waters, but a few whisper of a more sinister cause, something that lures the desperate to their doom. Initiates of the Flame are looking for powerful adventurers to help since the authorities have more pressing trouble.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: Monsters of the Deep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part 2 of the Hunters of the Sea Trilogy

Ships have been raided, their much-needed goods gone missing. Witnesses talk about a green dragon and its scaled servants, but there are hardly any trees on windswept Norheim, let alone a true forest. Regardless, the goods need to be recovered, the monsters dealt with. Are you up to the task?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: Wolves of the Sea
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part 3 of the Hunters of the Sea Trilogy

An expedition has gone missing. Rumors surface that reavers based in the pirate city of Westhaven are selling slaves to unscrupulous merchants. Is the expedition still alive? Can you uncover the slavers and rescue the expedition before it’s too late?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 3 Characters. Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: Powerful
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Powerful, is an accessible superhero-themed tabletop roleplaying game. The mechanics within this game are meant to emulate the ridiculously overpowered superheroes from comic, television, and video games.

Players can create entirely unique superpowers with Powerful's modular system, there is literally thousands of possible power combinations.

boardgame.name: Santa Monica: Fox Games Promo Card
boardgame.description:
A special card representing the Polish publisher's office available when ordering the Polish edition directly from Fox Games.

Card has no text but does include icons and values at the bottom right.

boardgame.name: Alakablast
boardgame.description:
The final exam in the school of magic has begun... The worst students will duel each other in a fierce battle to avoid repeating the course one more time.

Each player will manage a hand of cards that represent different kinds of spells, and use them to win magic duels. The problem is that you will start the game without knowing all your spells.

In every turn you can either ask for clues about your hidden cards, or you can challenge another player to a power or element duel playing a card from your hand in front of you. You will have to gather and deduce information of your hand to play the cards strategically and obtain victory points. The first player in obtain certain quantity of victory points (depending the number of players) will be the winner.

Show that you paid some attention in class, and that you are at least able to recognize the basic elements and their power levels.

Discover Alakablast and try to achieve victory in this intense fight to pass the course!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: El Mundo Oscuro: Expansión Oscura
boardgame.description:
10 cards with which players will create deadly combinations with unexpected results. It is used to have more cards and to be able to play modalities such as EXPERT, VERSUS and RANDOM.

With this expansion you will experience masterful plays, experience how the game grows and mutates ... change a card in the deck, change the game ... Swap cards, customize your deck and you will experience a fantastic and fun competition.

Nuevos Bufones (Descarta 4 / Revela y Pierde)
Dark Gangster
Sibila Oscura
Bruja Oscura
Nuevos Popes (Utiliza / Cancela)
Senadores (Toma 1)
Emperador Oscuro
Emperatriz Oscura

boardgame.name: El Mundo Oscuro: Expansión Limitada
boardgame.description:
If you liked the Dark Expansion, these new cards are for you ... Surprise your opponent with these unique cards totally out of series for their new mechanics and effects.

Decide to play more cards in any turn just by REVEALING THEM, creating new combinations and plays that will put pressure on your rivals with new and infamous actions.

Nuevo Bufón (Elige 1 / Comodín / Juega 1 / Cancela todo)
Nuevo Gangster Oscuro
Nueva Sibila Oscura
Nueva Bruja
Nuevo Pope (Revela / Saltea)
Nuevo Senadores
Nuevo Emperador Oscuro
Nueva Emperatriz Oscura
Caín Oscuro
Lilith Oscura.

boardgame.name: U.S. Civil War: 3CP
boardgame.description:
March 4th, 1861. In his inaugural address, President Abraham Lincoln promises not to invade the south or curtail slavery as long as tariffs are collected there and forwarded to the federal government. The south secedes from the Union nonetheless. Lincoln won’t let it go, however, and attempts to reinforce Fort Sumter (in his view still federal property) in Confederate South Carolina, provoking the south into firing the first shots. Its cannons level the fort, albeit without loss of life. War fever in the north is at its zenith, and the stage is set – for the U.S. Civil War.

During this game you’ll compete for cards representing Infantry, Artillery, Cavalry and Generals – by playing hands of 3-card poker. (Hence, “3CP” in the game’s title.) However, since this is more or less a friendly competition, the “pots” are not winner-take-all. Instead, the winner of a round will gain two components, while his/her opponent will gain one – and it’s the winner’s decision. Close attention to your needs and those of your opponent is required. Your goal is, ideally, to build four Brigades, each with a General and Supplies, and perhaps one additional Brigade if you’re lucky. Card management in the form of “what poker hand to play now and what to save for later” is also an important factor toward winning the game.

This is the third game in a series using the 3CP Game Engine™, which employs custom cards and a deck of standard playing cards.

boardgame.name: Port CiCi Atlas & Adventure on Bignose Isle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A desperate man seeking employment on your ship, a murder on the town street and a tattooed map are at the core of this adventure.
boardgame.rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game

boardgame.name: Of Evil & Good: Port Charles Atlas & Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Caution: This adventure has some mature themes that may not be suitable for younger players. What starts as a simple visit to port for supplies turns intooa life or death struggle against evil.
boardgame.rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game

boardgame.name: Pumasi
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are passengers aboard the interstellar ark Nabi. The ship’s cryo tubes have malfunctioned, causing your clan and others to awaken prematurely, but the captain and crew are still in stasis as “sleepers.” There are 90 years left until you arrive at your destination, New Earth. You must maintain the ship and its onboard sustainable farms for the remainder of your journey. Without the captain and crew to offer guidance, you draw inspiration from the agricultural customs of communal labor—PUMASI. Each player represents a group of passengers, or a clan, aboard the ship. A clan may be a family, company, guild, or other tight-knit group.
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 19/20 - Jul/Aug 1995)
boardgame.description:
Magia i Miecz

Nr. 19/20

Jul/Aug 1996

boardgame.name: Shake & Make
boardgame.description:
A quick shake changes the position of the dice. Play solo, or take turns to play heat to head with a friend.

Shake & Make is a pure-luck game that is contained entirely in a single small plastic dome. Shake the dome and 4 dice fall into slots to display 4 random numbers. A rulebook (attached to the bottom of the dome) summarized different patterns, mostly following Yahtzee/Poker pattern rankings. Play solo for the best combination or competitively by comparing to see who rolled the best pattern.

Take turns to see who can get the best score - Highest total, 1 pair, 2 pair, straight, 3-of-a-kind, 4-of-a-kind...

Do you have the luck to shake and make the best roll?

boardgame.name: Rocketmen: Giant Playing Mat
boardgame.description:
A neoprene playing mat, laser cut, 67×67 cm size, with enlarged areas for easier gameplay.

—Description from the Kickstarter campaign

Weight: 690 g
UPC: 5-900741-508757

listing.notes: Title: Rocketmen: Giant Playing Mat Publisher: PHALANX

boardgame.name: The Big Six game box
boardgame.description: Bundle of six family/party card games. Each deck has about a hundred cards. Included are "Battle of the Ages" (Kids v Grown-ups trivia, "The Big Quiz" (Basic trivia), "Charades", "Mimic the Music" (a capella humming Name That Tune), "Impossible Decisions" (Would you rather do/have this or that? - both suck), "Who Am I?" (Think Inglorious Basterds bar scene). Included are minute timer, headbands for "Who Am I?" and rule sheet for all six games.

boardgame.name: Board Royale: The Island – Wild Hunt Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
The creatures of K.R.A.K.E.N. Industries escaped from their cages and they are hungry. Fighting side-by-side with other survivors and cooperating with them is your only choice. Hunt or be hunted!

This expansion turns competitive Board Royale gameplay into a cooperative strategic experience. Face against deadly creatures, team up with other survivors and animal companions, strategize your plan, fight for your life, and defeat bosses! If anyone dies, the game is over!

listing.notes:
Part of this lot : https://boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/product/2889274
Do not purchase this item. If you want it, please purchase the lot at the link above.

boardgame.name: MadJack
boardgame.description:
MadJack is a trick-taking game for two players that has two phases. During the first phase, players juggle capturing tricks and building their hand for the second phase. For the second phase of the game, players have the opportunity to capture Prize Cards that will be a huge help in winning the round.

Be wary of the wily Jacks. They will change rank depending on the card that leads the trick or the Prize Card that is up for grabs during the second phase. The player who wins the most cards during the round earns points, and the first person to earn 10 points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Adventure Realms
boardgame.description:
After the last Dark Moon, the Demon King, Blasphemy, broke in
the the Kingdom of Arcadia and stole the 4 Elemental Stones of our world. With that much power, it is inevitable that he will destroy the mighty Kingdom and undoubtedly everyone in it. The King is looking for brave leaders to recruit heroes, gain power within the guilds, and race through the dungeon to destroy Blasphemy. Will you adventure through the realms?

Adventure Realms is a worker placement and deck building game in which you will recruit new heroes, gain power within the guilds, and race through the dungeon. Gain powerful elemental stones to enhance certain items and heroes and gain extra end game victory points. You can also complete quests by meeting certain requirements. Stuck in lower levels of the dungeon? No worries, just play some devastating magic cards to gain the lead in the dungeon.

Adventure Realms is completely done in beautiful 16-bit graphics by FinalBossBlues and graphically designed by Pete Jank. It is reminiscent to the old school Super Nintendo games such as Final Fantasy and Dragon Quest.

On a player's turn, they will play 1 of their hero cards and place an agent into an Agent Space. These spaces will gain you specific rewards. On top of that, the hero card you played will also give you specific resources or abilities for that turn.

The objective of Adventure Realms is to gain Journey Flags to race through the dungeon. Once everyone has passed on their turns, players will enter the dungeon phase in which magic cards can be played to boost your levels in the dungeon. The player who had traveled through the dungeon the furthest will gain the first player rewards. The game will continue like this until a player has gained 10 victory points or until the dungeon deck has run out.

boardgame.name: Gods and Heroes
boardgame.description:
A fast-paced Battle card game, with Drafting and in-game Deck-Building for 2 players (4 player rules can be added via stretch goals!).

Gods and Heroes is a battle of strength and prestige between warring Gods and their subjects. Build Temples of worship to bolster your armies and weaken your foes. Let loose your mightiest Heroes and crush your enemies in the name of your chosen Deity!

Each player represents a God, or Goddess fighting for dominion over the Lost Realm. Players draw and play cards to attack the other Temple Guardians. Once all a player's temple guardians are destroyed, a player loses the game.

Victory goes to the one who destroys all enemy Temple Guardians. Alternatively, whoever cannot discard three cards during a reshuffle, loses.

boardgame.name: Muerte Subita
Sudden Death
boardgame.description:
If you like to have fun with card games, as easy to learn as UNO, you will love this game, it is very easy and fun.

Each player starts with 5 lives (sets). Every turn, the player has to put a card on the center trying not to pass 21. Players count the numbers on their cards and, if they are more than 21, you lose one of your 5 sets. If a player loses all 5 sets (lives), they are eliminated from the game. The winner is the last player in the game.

Cards have a Tennis theme.

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Basically Wooden Box Organiser
boardgame.description:
The insert has 3 sections which fit together perfectly to provide safe organisation for your Arkham Horror collection.

2 Card trays with 12 removable dividers can take sleeved cards and keep the Player Cards and Scenario Cards in order.

The 5 Investigator mini cards are in a small box.

4 removable token trays enable quick setup ready to play. One long narrow tray sits neatly under the sloping end of the 2 card trays and can take Chaos tokens - the other trays hold the Damage tokens, Resource tokens, Clue/Doom tokens and the Horror tokens.

Rules reference, campaign guide and learn to play books sit neatly on top and the lid closes fully.

A great organiser for a great game!

The organiser can take sleeved or unsleeved cards.

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Basically Wooden Book Box with Token Box
boardgame.description:
An Arkham Horror Card Game Collection box, designed to stand on your shelf like books.
Each one features a beautifully engraved spine - open the lid and see all the cards neatly stored with sleeves - for example, one box will take the base game plus The Dunwich expansion.

The token box has 5 slots for all the game tokens, The lid of the token box doubles up as a card holder

The box with the Token box will take 650 UNSLEEVED CARDS - or 450 SLEEVED - depending on how many dividers are used.
The Card box only will take 900 UNSLEEVED CARDS - or - 650 SLEEVED - all dependant on the number of dividers used!

Rule books sit neatly on top so you can close the box. Stand it up in pride of place on your shelf…!

The box measures 270 x 210 x 90mm

boardgame.name: De Vermis Mysteriis
boardgame.description:
(user summary)
This is an extensive collection of mythos tomes and their stats, contained spells and game effects.

boardgame.name: Rostocks Sieben
boardgame.description:
(from the back of the book)
Rostock - the spiritually and economically leading metropolis on the Baltic Sea, which looks back on more than 800 years of history. A Hanseatic city that was occupied by the Swedes during the Thirty Years' War and suffered terrible destruction in a devastating city fire in the 17th century.

Rostock in August 1927: The Seven are back and a madman plunges the city into chaos and ruin. The pyre and the gallows line the streets.

Ideally four investigators must stop him in this adventure and save Rostock before the city suffers a fate that no history book tells us!

boardgame.name: Dungeoneers: Silver City
boardgame.description:
This expansion will provide details regarding your heroes visits to Silver City. You can now visit the guilds and buy profession specific equipment, visit the fortune teller, choose a bank to care for your money or take on side quest parallel to you primary quest. There is even more equipment added, including 10 new potions. You can earn money by participating in horse racing, gambling or by fighting in the arena. Finally, you can spend your hard earned money on an estate which you and your party can use as a base. As time goes, you can improve this base to prepare yourself even better for the coming quests.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ultra Age
boardgame.description: Ultra Age features pulse-pounding combos with multiple blade types, wire pull action and a slew of upgrades for the main character and his droid. Set in a futuristic, post-apocalyptic world brought to the brink of ruin, the story follows Age, the sword-wielding hero, who must fight to prevent the extinction of humankind.

boardgame.name: Tanares RPG
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Tanares, a high-fantasy campaign setting for the 5th Edition of the world’s greatest roleplaying game. With almost 1,000 pages, the book set features an abundantly detailed world, four unique, bold, extensively playtested new classes, four original races, hundreds of unique illustrations, and hundreds of subclasses, spells, feats, and backgrounds — plus more.

In Tanares, whenever war was waged, the bloodshed summoned a powerful, frenzied Dragon that buried the civilizations involved, resetting History and forever changing the landscape. This dystopian world is kept together and on a short leash by an Empire that forbids large armed gatherings. Under this decree, and without many high-level adventurers out there, your Team may become one of the most powerful units in the world. Build an Adventure Team Sheet, earn Career Points and level up, design a headquarters and flag, and effect real change to all aspects of the scenario…

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares RPG
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Tanares, a high-fantasy campaign setting for the 5th Edition of the world’s greatest roleplaying game. With almost 1,000 pages, the book set features an abundantly detailed world, four unique, bold, extensively playtested new classes, four original races, hundreds of unique illustrations, and hundreds of subclasses, spells, feats, and backgrounds — plus more. Working also as an expansion to Arena: The Contest and Tanares Adventures, you can experience the power of these new features as new classes, sub-classes, and races as the miniatures also come with everything you need to play them on our board games too.

Behold the majesty of the new Gold Dragon and the new, fearsome Penumbral Dragon, ready for the fight on Boss Vs. Boss mode, found on the Dragon Collection Expansion. Meet the warlords from Arena: The Contest, in new, exclusive miniatures, complete with new cards. Face the terror of the new foes from the Penumbral Plane and complete your 3d scenery collection with the new Scenario Pack.

In Tanares, whenever war was waged, the bloodshed summoned a powerful, frenzied Dragon that buried the civilizations involved, resetting History and forever changing the landscape. This dystopian world is kept together and on a short leash by an Empire that forbids large armed gatherings. Under this decree, and without many high-level adventurers out there, your Team may become one of the most powerful units in the world. Build an Adventure Team Sheet, earn Career Points and level up, design a headquarters and flag.

Effect real change to all aspects of the scenario, be it with your 5E party or through the Solo Mode, a 300+ card deck that lets 1-4 players live and play the Adventure without a GM! Become a Hero, change the world's fate, and take your game to the next level.

boardgame.description:
Six German promocards for War of the Worlds: The New Wave:

Dog Scout
Spyder (Spinne)
Bombardment (Bombardierung)
Orbital Strike (Angriff aus dem Orbit)
Draw Energy (Energie saugen)
Tesla (Tesla)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: War of the Worlds: The New Wave

boardgame.name: Evolution: New World
Эволюция. Новый мир
boardgame.description:
The diversity of living organisms inhabiting our planet is astonishing. According to the theory of evolution, random mutations occur all the time, granting new traits to animals and plants. These traits are then tested through natural selection. Animals with beneficial traits propagate more successfully than others, expand their habitat areas, and effectively protect themselves against predators and unfavorable conditions. Such species dominate the ecosystem, while poorly adapted animals become extinct.

Evolution. New World is an updated and extended version of the basic Evolution. The Origin of Species game. It includes both well-known animal traits and new ones, complete with refined descriptions and colorful illustrations. Food is now generated using Area cards, and animals can use shelter to hide from predators.

—description from the rulebook

boardgame.name: Battle Havoc!
boardgame.description:
Battle Havoc! is easy to learn and play fantasy wargame where each player commands an army and lead it to the victory on the battlefields. Thanks to alternative activation, all players are involved continuously in action.

Each unit represents up to a few hundreds of men and the game doesn’t have any particular scale, as players can choose to play with either 28mm or 10mm miniatures.

Fight big battles with just a handful miniatures!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Scape Goat Chooser Deck
boardgame.description: This is an add-on for the social deduction game Scape Goat. This add-on contains 10 cards that provide an alternate way to select the Scape Goat before the start of the game.

boardgame.name: Crime game: Death in Tillstetten
boardgame.description:
Take on the investigative work in an exciting criminal case!
Follow the clues. Who has a motive? Are the alibis correct?
Excitement and fun with numerous hints.
For some of the research you need access to the internet.
You are forming a special commission to investigate a murder. The previous police investigations have not been successful.

The police headquarters finally needs progress, and therefore sent you the order to take over the investigation. With the order you will receive the investigation results found so far for the case in an envelope.

The group of potential perpetrators has already been narrowed down somewhat. Now your creativity and a sense of crime is required.

Work your way through the evidence and clues discovered so far, do research.

Do suspects have alibis and are out of the question for the crime? Who is the perpetrator?

Examine the various clues, discuss in the group what motives the suspects might have had to commit a murder. Who has something to hide?

It is best if your special commission consists of 2-7 players to determine together. The game can also be played solo.

You can be creative and use tools during the investigation. Research on the Internet may also be necessary to track down the perpetrator.

boardgame.name: Children of the Court
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This game is a 2-5 player roguelike about humans escaping the realm of faerie after being stolen as children. Each time you try to escape, the world changes around you, and you must start from the beginning again.

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #9 - Aug 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon (https://www.patreon.com/LegendaryLoot) and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the wand of wall building, singularity grenade, fractured phylactery, and blade-eating battleaxe!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like withering touch, spiked crevasse, litany of rebuke, and phoenix wings!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the new elemental savant, school of alchemy, and oath of exorcism!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the undead huecuva, the carnivorous boulder okpe, and the explosive cannon golem!

boardgame.name: Parallel Worlds (Issue 24 - Aug 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue:

Brent A. Harris, the art of Black Void, Chivalry & Sorcery, Gamesmasterclass, original fiction, Rangers of Shadow Deep, Treantmonk, War in the Heavens, Wildermyth
boardgame.rpg: Rangers of Shadow Deep: A Tabletop Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Shuttlecraft & Recon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Starship Builder Kit has been designed to allow you to utilize various stylized starship sections to compile your very own custom starship deckplan. You can use any graphics editing software that support PNG format to combine the piec-es, drop them directly into your favorite virtual tabletop (VTT) application, or even print and cut them out to be put together to make a tabletop play map.

This series of kits is designed to allow you to mix-and-match any of the sections included herein with sections included in other sets in the series.

Herein you will find over 40 ship sections (a double pack of the regular 20-part kits) including three sample ships built utilizing the included resources are area sections.
